jTusFy_RyoJy46E7pAMVjA.text: We came in 40 minutes to their posted closing time and was given the hmm should we sit em or not look and thankfully they showed us to a table. The food is definitely not spectacular and hygiene in kitchen is probably non existent but you have to forget about that if you want to enjoy some dim sum on a random evening. Food was good but even better with the killer hot chilli oil they have on the table. Dont come here for the service- our waitress gave a rude "hhmph!" when we asked for a to go box. But when youre craving Chinese and you wanna feel sleepy beepy from MSG come here! (Feels so wrong but so good)

Wkqfhin2QaJpUBiCDiW6Fw.text: Food is average, price is over the roof! You can find way better places than this, and pay a lot better food for $70 for less than 10 tiny plates. This place suck!!! And will charge you extra plates that you did'nt even get..

-e0I1QA7hGUfi-eQNp_TaA.text: Dim Sum appears to have really gone down hill over the last few years in terms of cleanliness and food quality.  A few nights ago we ordered take out - just one order of sesame chicken.  Got it home and it was way undercooked / raw.  Instead of nice crispy and brown on the outside it was soggy and pink.  No way anyone with the least amount of care should have let it go out of the kitchen.  We are sadly done with Dim Sum and will not be going back.  If you want decent Chinese try Soho Bistro in uptown.

jw05jblsRfaLT9CL1hrXfg.text: Been looking for a great Dim Sum place for a while and ran across this place which isn't too far from my place. I can't remember the name of the dish that I had, but it was delicious. My fiance and I went out on a limb and tried some shark fin dumplings and squid. While I'm quite familiar with shark anyway, being Caribbean, the squid kind of surprised me. For some reason I wasn't expecting it to be served cold, but it was still good. The texture kind of threw me off a little bit, as it has a slight "crunch," but I still enjoyed it! I can't wait to come back to take part in the actual dim sum menu to see how good the options are!

Hd9vWY_lvYh_B3Tv8_tcqA.text: This place is over priced and do not trust the prices on yelp because they don't match up with what they actually charge you when you pick up your food. Food doesn't have much flavor and the place from the outside look kinda sketchy.

cLZCP71xhCnsRYvP2rE3ng.text: Best Dim Sum in Charlotte. I love the no frills, strip mall appearance of the restaurant. Staff was very friendly, food came out quickly and was delicious!   I have been here on Sundays when they push the carts around - I like that so you can "see" what you are ordering. I did Dim Sum last night and went off of the pictures on the menu (see picture). Price was OK, not too expensive or cheap.   I will go back. More fun with a larger group of people so you can share!

HVAAwVKWeGK3o_-06QHehQ.text: Seated right away. Within one minute a cart was at our table. They described each dish to us and served us with a smile. Carts continued to come quickly - we were never left wanting for food. Lots of options to choose from. Our favorites were: sesame balls, fried pork bun, steamed BBQ bun, steamed shrimp dumplings, Chinese broccoli, and the pork and shrimp dumpling. We saw that other tables were also able to order things like duck and lo mien but we came just for the dim sum. Great service. Place was completely packed with a full waiting room. Worth the trip.

D_e3YwHJIMouyNzWToeR6g.text: Best duck in town I been here many times and always duck is perfect. Special fried rice and the stuff eggplant simple the best this by far the best Chinese restaurant in Charlotte

l5-XRbcxZ1w6En0fSHxJtQ.text: I will say that the restaurant is very welcoming and bright and friendly and it looks great on the inside but I have just found better Chinese food elsewhere. Here the experience is what really draws people back. You would just have to go to understand.

TdQWeUXvr1f8ghKqOm4tfA.text: Being big Dim Sum fans and having tried it in multiple large cities across the country, we can honestly say that this restaurant was fantastic! We had been there quite a few times when it was owned by the previous owner and were hesitant to try it based on the reviews since it changed hands. We are so glad we went to see and taste for ourselves.  The dim sum carts were rolling and had plenty of delicious offerings, many of which were even better than under the previous owner. We had the Turnip Cake with Chinese Sausage, Taro Stick on Shrimp Biscuit, Fried Sesame Balls, Steamed Roast Pork Bun, Roast Duck, Fried Crispy Shrimp Toast, Stuffed Eggplant, Steamed Chinese Spinach, and Shrimp Rice Noodle Crepe. Everything was outstanding! The Shrimp Rice Noodle Crepe had more flavor than any we've tried before. The service was great and we walked away stuffed! We were one of the few occidentals in the restaurant and that in itself says a lot about the authenticity and high quality of the food.  We arrived at 11:30 and there were very few tables open. We can't wait to go back!

voAPmdujPux9wzv18QSJgw.text: I like Dim Sum Chinese.   It can definitely use a makeover. Not necessarily the cleanest, nicest digs. And the day that we went, we got there soon after it opened...thus, we were the only ones in attendance and thus, the energy was a little low in there.   So I cannot accurately describe the service, other than to say that they were very attentive to us :) But I hear that it gets super busy on the weekends and that it's a completely different vibe in there.   But ultimately you want to know about the food right?   The food was pretty good. To be honest, we really enjoyed the various dishes that we tried. The dumplings seem to come to mind as I write this. Pork and shrimp dumplings were excellent.  The prices are very reasonable. If you give it a shot, I think you'll like it!

FsGtCdQCZFfa1BA4HCHDDQ.text: Weekend mornings, legit Dim Sum!  Really enjoy the food here each time I come for Dim Sum on the weekends.  When there's loads of Chinese people each time I come here, you certainly get the feeling that you're enjoying some authentic food.  Be prepared to not know what everything is! Not that I've had food I didn't enjoy, and they are always willing to try and help you understand.  Can definitely keep this under budget, and with all the small size choices rolling around you won't leave dissapointed.

zc9RwY6L9oI5iaBpd6UxEQ.text: Friendly staff, fantastic food. Don't let the outside fool you - this place is great!

oNbR7rvyxHMWm-r6uye5zg.text: Pan dumplings were amazing . The rice and the chicken with broccoli were not good to me. Neither was the egg rolls. I wasn't expecting the kind of meal I received based on the reviews. Wouldn't go here again.

Yghf0uM3rkoURaxediCR5Q.text: i think this is a good place to dim sim. maybe i carried low expectation to try it out. but the taste is fine,you cant compare it with dim sim places in nyc or la, but i m from alt i think its not bad. for people live in charlotte and like dim sim, probably the best choice.

JjrxkdIntoWQ4SW7nTmixw.text: For Charlotte, it's the best dim sum restaurant in town. The food is fresh, very tasty, and it's a relatively authentic experience. If we're comparing to dim sum restaurants in other cities, it would only get 3 stars. The reason is because the food does not come on carts with heating elements. Truly authentic dim sum restaurants actually cook/steam the foods directly on the carts. So it mostly translates to the temperature of the food and crispiness of the fried items. But if you're in Charlotte and want some dim sum, this is as good as it gets and it's still a very good experience, just don't expect it to be as good as you might find elsewhere in the country.

Ufu4vBbdqLTS_qYe4ldaBA.text: After a year of being in Charlotte, I finally gotten around to go to this place.. Hearing all the hype about this place.  Place - decent, reminds me of your typical Chinese restaurant that just needs a bit more of a reno (that is just me being picky).  The restaurant was easy to find, with their red and yellow sign. Parking may be tough if it is busy, since there are limited spots in the front.  A friend suggested to come early Sat at 11am, to get a table before it quickly fills up.  Food - not great, but good. I guess it is as good as it will get in Charlotte. I do miss Houston, TX and NYC's dim sum food.     . I found the 'ha gao' (shrimp dumpling in clear flour) to be mushy =\    . Their steamed rice with pork, sausage, and mushroom wrapped in banana leaf - was delicious and fulfilling    . Egg custard is good, happy with the taste.    . Chrysanthemum tea is good to help with digestion when you are full.    . My husband who avoids eating chicken feet, was pushed to try it from a friend of ours - he actually liked it. Said the flavor was better than others that he have tried before.  Service - good enough.

Z6wCTburnIjCze9AFFIn0A.text: It was a Sunday evening in Plaza Midwood and I found myself hungry with a taste for Asian cuisine. I turned to Yelp to find the highest rated spot and Dim Sum seemed to be the best option. I called my order in and figured the food would be great based off the very thick accent on the other side of the phone. My meal consisted of basic Chinese-American fare which I figured would be a safe bet for takeout. I got back to the friend's apartment I was visiting to find that there were no utensils in the bag with our food (none were on display at the Dim Sum restaurant counter either.) The friend I was visiting had just moved in that day and had no accessible utensils, causing me to leave AGAIN to run to the nearest store and pickup forks. When I finally got to eat my dinner, I was severely disappointed. The sesame chicken was okay- the flavor was adequate but the meat tasted cheap and the sauce appeared to be cut with water. The thin, diluted sauce pooled at the bottom of the bowl making the undersides of the chicken soggy. I tried to ignore the fact that the sauce had been contaminated since, after all, it appeared to just be water.  Then I tried the fried rice. My biggest regret in life is that I swallowed the bite off my fork rather than spit it back out. Knowing that the rice was being processed by my body severely grossed me out for the rest of the night. I couldn't decide what would be worse- digesting the rice or the taste of throwing it back up.  Enough about how the rice made me feel and more about the reasoning why: It tasted like it had been soaked in a marinade of water and half decayed cigarette butts. There were no vegetables mixed with the rice and the texture itself seemed as if it had been through a continuous cycle of sitting out, getting microwaved and then set back out again. over and over.   When I went to throw out the entire container after my first bite, my friend protested and offered that he would eat whatever I did not wish to finish. Some background on this particular friend of mine: He will literally eat anything. My friend took a forkful of the rice and had the same immediate repulsion that I myself had endured. His exclamations reasserted my claim of the cigarette taste that clung to the underside of the throat in a heavy aftertaste that entices one to get sick out of some evolutionary reflex.  Maybe the actual Dim Sum cuisine is fine if dining in. Maybe the kitchen doubles as a smoking lounge. Whatever it may be, I regret the overpriced $20 I spent to not be able to actually eat my dinner.

Y5tFUkCKx6WwAppkcHrgnw.text: I went by here today with my SO and his mum, and it was pretty good! My 4-star review is situational, I would totally consider it 4 for Charlotte, but it is solid-passable 2-3 star maybe compared to the the dim sum palaces in Toronto, Vancouver and HK proper. There were enough options circling for the pescetarian in our group to put together a meal, and I took home a roast duck plate for later, yum! Prices seemed a little high but that's ok, I do wish they had a menu of what they could bring out from the kitchen since my Cantonese is... rusty, to say the least, and I assume out of politeness my interactions with the staff were mostly in english so nobody at the table would feel left out.

d9h4CIJVy4-vdH9744612A.text: Even though Dim Sum is a 5 minute walk from our house we go across town to a different restaurant.  When we moved to Charlotte 6 years ago we tried Dim Sum & it was horribly greasy & unedible. A few years later we tried it again, still greasy.  We went last week and the food was totally different, possibly the best chicken fried rice I've ever had. It took forever for our food to come out since there were 4 or 5 huge (10+ people) & there was only cook.    The only negative was a crazy fight that broke out behind us about a crying child.

mQ-pq8djd6Nk79xnrRnhFg.text: I really wasnt blown away but Dim Sum on the two occasions I have done Take Out. I bave tried a few dishes from the menu and I feel like its your average chinese food. They do have a large menu so you have plenty of options!   I hear that when you dine in you have even more choices! Im dying to try the steam buns! Ill review again once I dine in!   I wiah so badly they delivered!

yDJHo5hVmEs2CyLqRoziLA.text: Okay so maybe I just don't like dim sum but that was one of the most atrocious meals I've ever eaten. Like a car wreck - I can stop thinking about it and I can want other people to experience it to validate my feelings.  The rice crepes were the worst - slimy soggy rice noodles.  The ribs were bones covered in tendons and gross things - not meat.  We couldn't finish I and I will never try dim sum again.

_aoAsFNNptaBbH6J23zCUQ.text: TURN AROUND. DO NOT COME HERE.  ABSOLUTELY BAD. HORRIBLE.  TURN AWAY NOW.  Zero Stars.  The food is cold and they will over charge you like crazy.  $70 for 8 items? Seriously?!  C'mon.. I get it, but c'mon. The food isn't even that great..

sZWEPe3OWPtIAeYuOUKUpA.text: We were craving good dim sum since a wonderful place in Matthew's closed and we found one right in Charlotte.  Weekends they have rolling carts and the selections are terrific.  Stuffed eggplant is excellent as is the shu mai with pork and shrimp.  Fun place to enjoy good food and conversation.  Go easy on your initial choices because the carts just keeping rolling out with more terrific dishes.

IXCpehQk31xOPRE23MKeyw.text: I didn't see the restaurant before with the old owner, but it still looks very nice. Very clean and open restaurant. The menu had the usual dim sum items, if they didn't run out of it. We ordered Chinese broccoli, shrimp dumplings, fried bananas, and a few other things that they have run out of. The food they did have was great, fresh and hot. I'm a little disappointed with their customer service though. The workers were very rude. We wanted to go ahead and ask for sauces and cups while we were waiting for our food. We thought it would be helpful for them so they when the food was coming out they wouldn't have to worry about it. But they have a specific way to serve a table. Our requests were interrupted by them saying not yet. Then they would wait a minutes to return and see what we needed. They seemed very annoyed with us. And we did not feel welcomed here.

PflXg9UxjAZnO0Hv5blkLw.text: Over priced mediocre dim sum. I can still handle mediocre food but will not accept a dishonest establishment! They over charged me for something I did not order and made me the bad person like I'm there to cheat them but they are the one that cheat customers. Wonder how many people fell victim to this place. Will not return and will not recommend to anyone.

FzlpOcH8ra0asn5KmMZeRA.text: I have been coming here for well over a decade and although I should be fluent in Cantonese, I'm not. However, I know the essentials... the names of all my favorite dim sum dishes. Luckily, you don't need to speak mandarin or Cantonese to order here and if you're not sure of what something is the servers are very helpful.  If you're looking for the traditional dim sum experience, you'll need to come here on the weekend because they only have the carts out then. You can still order dim sum any other day but it's a la carte and in my opinion, not their A game. They also have a bunch of menu options if you're looking for some specialty items or American Chinese dishes but can't comment on these because they do a bang up job on their dim sum and that's all I ever get.  Now onto the food, it's no simple task to be able to prepare so many different dishes, especially on a busy Saturday or Sunday morning so I have a huge amount of respect for the cooks. You really can't go wrong here and my favorites are their BBQ pork buns(both steamed and baked are delicious), har gow (shrimp dumplings), rice rolls with little dried shrimp, chicken feet (don't hate), eggplant with shrimp paste, and pretty much anything with their fried shrimp paste in it. Everything has great flavor, texture, overall deliciousness. As others have mentioned, they're tapas sized so you'll have the opportunity to try plenty of food; they're a couple bucks per plate. All that with some jasmine tea and I'm a happy camper.

Ghk2JruIT5QidI1OHIpOtg.text: Waiteress and all where nice. The food was cold and overpriced. We didn't even order that much food. Won't be going back there again.

9A4Sr-8CEk64i7_aswYlzQ.text: We had lunch here today.  It's certainly not like Dim Sum in Los Angeles but had a few tasty nibbles. The pork and shrimp shu mai (sp).  The potstickers were too doughy but the filling was good.  The duck had crispy skin and was ok. Nothing earth shattering. The Char Shu bao was ok but seemed like they may have been frozen. But the flavor was good. We had to try the chicken feet ... Um... Not sure why anyone would want to eat these and trying them did not change my mind.   The service was good. I would go back to try some of the other Chinese dishes just to give it a try.

wtIBzGuoitf0Zf0CF96L2w.text: We moved to Charlotte a few months ago and I am so happy to have found this dim sum place. Although there's not many to select from in Charlotte, this restaurant is pretty good and the staff is very nice. I highly recommend.

AlyKddk9KnsJpd7ax58m1g.text: Pretty good Dim sum. Prices a little high for quality. No Cafe or bottled water. Service was good.  Nothing special. I will say that the House fried rice was really yummy. 3 stars.

xbbFmv7iN96Nn1grywnsKg.text: I was about to give 4 star until when we checked out we were "reminded" to pay additional on tip...  To the owner- Lady you really don't know how to operation business with customer satisfaction. Don't try to assume people bad by not paying certain amount of tip. In fact we were about to give a good tip and wrote a good review on Yelp since we were so excited finally found a dim sum place in Charlotte.  However, now you have an unhappy family left your restaurant who is writing a two star review and exploring other dim sum option now...

fIafraxHGMnkJJ6M6xADFQ.text: Used to love this place.  Now the selection is more limited than the original but prices are higher?  Service is even worse and they need someone who needs to know how to work the credit card machine.  The weekend cart service is ok but they need to do a better job of hitting all the tables.  DO NOT let them put baby in the corner - you'll get passed by every cart.  They have also refused to offer the fried noodles for the soups which is weird and also no more honeydew sliced pork.  Only the basic dumplings are available and not very impressive.  Not sure if I'll be back.  Wish they would fix some of this.  Why is Charlotte so limited in good ethnic foods?!!!  Someone please come help us and put the PF Changs and Ruth's Chris' out of business!!!!!

Pr2rGMO5EkKdT0P9QtM4tg.text: Went on my way through town as this place was always a favorite. The decor is so much better. Staff was attentive. Food was as good as it was with the old management or owners or whatever. Would definitely go back again!

Bau5ec7r94OOTqLkMOxsNQ.text: Even did not fish the food, they bring the check to pay. And ask you when are you going to leave. Shit man I am not even finish. Do not kick me out. I am your customer. Bad service.

j6il8Xf6QE0HdL_1tPWMXw.text: I went to this restaurant with my boyfriend who is Chinese. He was sceptical at first but after trying the dim sum he became a fan. The restaurant has a very nice interior and the atmosphere is very cozy. The staff was very friendly as well. Definitely recommend!

GMleQVXydRTLcGKITiDcyw.text: I grew up eating dim sum in Hong Kong and also lived in NYC for years.  So when I moved to CLT I was dying to find a good place for semi-decent dim sum to satisfy my cravings.  However, having given this place its fair number of chances, I've now given up and have resorted to buying frozen dim sums and mastered my own won ton dumplings at home to beat those cravings.  In short, the dim sum is by far the worst I've had in my liffe, and they don't even come out warm.  Service is horrible even to Chinese customers.  The owner with the short hair has an attitude problem.  However, being the only dim sum place in town (Dragon Court doesn't even count with such a miserable location and setup), I suppose they can get away with anything, food quality or sanitation-wise.    Whenever we get a chance to visit NYC or HK we order dim sum like there's no tomorrow.  I am ashamed to tell our friends why.

zJXvUXIXYzgdQRPUvLnjdA.text: Highly authentic and traditional Chinese food, so good that I'm coming back again one week later. My new go to sport for Chinese!

W2_sxjpu_m2S4ymsaXEjqw.text: I'm giving this place five stars because it is a legit dim sum restaurant in Charlotte. It's legit because it has chicken feet in black bean sauce and because they roll out the dim sum on carts, it can be very busy on Sunday afternoon but it slows down around 1:30. They have some excellent dumplings as well as park spareribs, shrimp stuffed eggplant, lotus rice, etc. No atmosphere. It's a Chinese restaurant.

QDSiv1mDWwhhUsmkMcTq-g.text: Having lived in Worcester, Massachusetts (that's Woo-ster, not Wor-ches-ter) for nearly a decade and being just a 40 minute drive away from Boston where they have some of the best Dim Sum restaurants in the country, I can assure you that I know good Dim Sum when I taste it and Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant is miles from being in the same league as the worst Dim Sum restaurant in Boston.  On my first (and probably last) visit, I ordered just about everything on their Dim Sum menu. Traditionally, you're flagging down an attendant pushing around a cart and requesting them to lift up each lid so that you can peek at the deliciousness that is hidden underneath. If you want the item, they'll stamp your card (which is essentially your check) and scamper off to appease another table. They don't do that at this restaurant. Here, you order off a laminated menu with descriptions of the items, which certainly detracts from the Dim Sum experience.  All the items that I ordered were room temperature to cold. I've honestly had better shumai and har gow from the frozen food section of an Asian Supermarket. Some items were just inedible.  I hate wasting food and generally ask for to-go containers for my leftovers, but I can't imagine their food would taste any better hours later so I didn't.  I don't know if their other menu items are any good as I only went there for the Dim Sum, but Dim Sum is definitely not their strong point. I can't in good conscience recommend this restaurant to Dim Sum lovers or people with working taste buds. If you're craving simple Dim Sum items, go to the nearest G Mart or H Mart and buy some because Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant will do nothing to satisfy your craving for it.  I miss you, Chau Chow City. I await with bated breath, until our annual summer rendezvous, where I can once again ravish your hot, steamy buns.  I need a tissue.

1Uq592SbPNnzpuW5pVTLGw.text: This is the best Dim Sum restaurant in Charlotte, even though there are only 2 in Charlotte. This place is better. Get there by 1130AM if you don't want to wait in line. They push the dim sum carts around and you get your typical dim sum variety. Shu Mai, Shrimp balls, tripe, chicken feet, ribs, duck, and etc... Pricing is pretty typical $3.50 for small plate to $6.50 for a larger plate. You can also request a menu and order from that.   For tripe lovers out there this place no longer use real tripe for their tripe dish. Now they're using a different intestinal lining which is easier to cook, but doesn't taste as good as the normal tripe that we typically know and love.

7NgoPhCwX9lMPJN1zghmOA.text: Marginal at best Dim Sum and over priced.  Unfortunately I am unable to recommend. If you do try them make sure you check your bill, we ordered 2 hot teas but got billed for 2 teas and a soda.  Except we never ordered a soda or even had a soda. Luckily my spouse is Chinese and really good at math and spotted the error, but for an unassuming Jo you might not even notice the extra $2.11 on your tab!

-wvX_5wyStOJ2dULMsvaPg.text: If you think this is good dim sum then obviously you've never had dim sum before. Why does the chicken feet taste and look old ? Along with everything else. It was horrible. I guess you get what you pay for.

PUdgaPNVx11q2GW9a3TTyg.text: We stopped in for a late lunch just before 3. Everything we ordered was great but the BBQ pork and the duck are a must order. There's a lot of options on the carts. As soon as we sat down there were four different carts around our table. Choose wisely because your table and stomach will be full in no time!   We had always wanted the Dim Sum experience so we went in with high hopes. This place didn't disappoint. The inside is very nice... in contrast to the outside that looks sketchy as can be.

nVOo7kQTKvPABShp1SlaXA.text: We were so very sad when this placed closed earlier this year. And at the time, it was closed for good. So, my family was very happy to hear, out of the blue,  it reopened about 4 or 5 months later.   There were some upgrades to the atmosphere and but basically still the same layout and feel. Everyone looked to be new to us and only a couple of the waiters were carried from the restaurant before the closure. However, the new manager claim that nothing had changed, he stressed it the same restaurant and menu. Hmm...   No comment on the service since, it was none existence that night. Clearly, the management and wait staff were still trying to figure this out. No one said running a restaurant is easy or straightforward. The challenges and difficulties can be very overwhelming especially for noobies...   So the dim sum was mostly the same but changed a bit. The overall menu changed slightly but mostly the same but some noticeable changes to some of our favorite.   The taste and texture of the dishes mostly did change, not quite as good, definitely not as familiar.   Most alarming, I asked the new manager for some chili oil which I did not see on any tables. The manager told me to hold while he would grab some Sriracha...? I asked again for traditional chili oil and he responded to me that Sriracha is better.... whatever! If I can't get chili oil for my dumplings and dim sum dishes then I would rather not go that the restaurant.   I hoping the new(old?) management have worked out all it bugs and maybe the food prep as well as. I will try this place again because I am pulling for Dim Sum and want to have at lease some descent dim sum in Charlotte.

pdh78P8XwFywzzRFPgrdvg.text: The BBQ pork buns tasted sour, chicken sticky rice reeked, and my menu was sticky. Do yourself some justice and go to Dragon's Court for dimsum.

6LYvGjuRReFocW4GdWWFEA.text: Be aware don't order sea bass. They don't mention on price and charge $45/lb. Think about if they mention, will you order? Nobody. And also charge more on dim sum than that I ordered. Be careful.

pDyLBU-Mzoq0p48Tn20B8A.text: This is a perfectly acceptable place to eat dim sum in Charlotte. Note, I said in Charlotte. We have very, very few options when it comes to this delicious dining category, so when you're craving taro dumplings or har dow dumplings your options are really limited. Dim Sum will satisfy your craving, but you won't walk out saying this is the best bunch of dumplings you've ever had. If you are avoiding the specific dim sum menu, I  would steer away from the traditional American-Chinese dishes and ask the staff if they have any specials that aren't listed on the menu. Go with their recommendations and you'll probably have a great experience. I had a great dandelion dish there this past spring that wasn't advertised. The service is really good. The staff is friendly, the kitchen is fast and it's a fun activity on a Saturday or Sunday morning.

21ngbmEPG1DwHqCQJCAkrw.text: Tried it today. Staff was busy, hustling around but restaurant wasn't full. A lot of open seats. Got seated relatively quick, ordered drinks, got drinks fine, ordered food.sat and waited, wife's soup came out she ate that, it's good, wife got two dishes of her 5, she ate a couple of those partially, one wasn't good, all grizzly no meat. Another family came in and seated across the isle, 6-8 people, my wife gets another dish, it's good, while shes eating that her next dish comes, it like a fritter stuffed with meat, onion, it's undercooked, barely warm inside and battery, meanwhile the people who just got seated like 10 min ago are getting there food, I still don't have my food, and my wife hasn't gotten all of her food, so she's done eating what she could still waiting for the final dish, after we sent back the one dish, and I still haven't sniffed food yet. All I ordered was fried rice meal, simple Chinese food, not difficult, nothing hard about it. We've been here 35-40 min, the other table just sat 15 min ago is enjoying their food. Then they bring back the undercooked dish and ask again what the problem is with it. At this point we said just bring us the bill! Were done. They take off the two items of hers that they didn't bring and that was undercooked, not the inedible one that was all grizzly. And the food she did eat she said was flavorless, had to drown it in soy sauce to eat it. So one time is enough, no second chance here!

PSecZ2QByUGiwXyD37OGVg.text: It's the only dimsum place in Charlotte. The restaurant is far from nice. It has low ceiling and doesn't have any windows. It offers nice selection of Dimsum food. It's a Chinese breakfast in small plate (kind of like tapas). The food comes in small portion and push in little cart. I find it a little frustrating to communicate with the waitresses with their limited English. Overall, this restaurant offers dimsum.

3lvu6UwNk8Sied7qczyjzw.text: Visited there with my family on a random monday around 12pm under the new management, the place is empty.  $2 tea charge per head is more expensive than some of the finest restaurants on the coast.  I understand that they are the only dim sum restaurant in charlotte and it is very hard to find qualified restaurant workers locally.  But it doesnt mean us, as the consumers, should be punished by the bad quality food with expensive price tag.  We had 8 different dim sum for the first round, and it is impossible for us to finish the food and able to order a second round.  At $4.5 a tray, i expect a little more heart on their dishes.  A good $50 wasted and we wont be back.

mhK7AdM25m_YAbbRCVtQcw.text: We arrived right before noon on Sunday & were seated by the sweet hostess at the front. Our table was close to the entrance and my mom mentioned she was cold due to the breeze from the door. The owner happened to hear us and promptly moved us without us having to ask. The carts were full of fresh items and everything was delicious. The eggplant was my favorite. I must also note that when the owner moved us to a corner table, he ensured the carts would come out way. He even returned to our table and asked us what he needed and brought it right over. Great customer service on his part! My husband and I order takeout from here all the time and have yet to run into any issues.

1aPILzpWxpxhAWlxpyKLRQ.text: They have remodeled and reopened. The decor has been upgraded and is more simple and understated. The prices are fair and the dim sum is delicious as always. I can't wait to bring my wife back over here. It was her favorite. At night you order off the menu and the dim sum is prepared to order. They even have a picture menu if your unsure of what to order.

S2Ox1PzVFE31mbo7aj7J2A.text: My food was undercooked! The pork/shrimp shui mai we ordered was not fully cooked at all. We told our waiter and she bought it back to the kitchen to ask them, then she came back and apologized and asked if we would like to replace it or take it off the check. Wth! . Take it off please cus that was disgusting. . We ordered at least 8 dishes. And also I didn't feel like my beef crepes was fully cooked. (One of my favs!) after knowing the shui mai was undercooked I just didn't feel safe eating the other items. ALSO...! They didn't have the pecking duck! (BBQ roasted duck). Such a disappointment dim sum visit. This place used to be my fav spot for dim sum until the recent new management.

0WBlc0ykOAHjRJzvFGYF_Q.text: I ordered the honey chicken to go and it took 20 minutes to get my food, only to later realize that there was no sauce on my chicken, and trying the chicken it was dry and chewy, overall would never go back.

k1LT0Tr-t8Ll8fOb7QkI7A.text: Worst ever! The duck was all fat, bones and grease. No meat! Dumplings were cold. I paid my check and left in less then 15 minutes. I did register my complaint with the wait staff & management, neither could care less!

May5G9X0lOLlCJ_lT6ZZTA.text: This used to be one of my favorite places to go on the weekends when I lived in Plaza Midwood area.  When I moved to another city and we came back to visit, this was my go-to place.  I don't know why I never wrote a review because I really like the dim sum here.  And this place has definitely undergone some changes since we lived here before - an updated interior that looks cleaner and new owners, apparently.    Unless something has changed, you can order dim sum from the menu on weekdays, but on the weekends they have the carts.  This is my favorite because you can see what they're offering and make a decision that way.  They have some pretty dumplings (I like their shrimp ones in particular) and meat dishes, but two things in particular are my go-to dishes.  Their sticky rice is hands down my favorite rice dish ever.  I like that it's a little sweet, has little bits of flavorful meat in the middle, and has a terrific flavor to it from the lotus leaf it's wrapped in.  The sesame bun is my other favorite.  The texture is light and the filling is a little sweet and nutty from the sesame.  We like to try interesting things, which are sometimes a miss for us, but overall most of their dishes we have tried are good.  The only problem is that it is so easy to find yourself with too many dishes and end up with a large bill if you don't watch it.    When we came on around noon on a Saturday, the carts started coming quickly and the food on them was plenty warm and fresh.  It wasn't too busy so the service was pretty good.  Everyone was friendly and we had a good experience.  I'm not sure how good the service is when they get busy, as I generally come when I know it's less busy.  I really like Dim Sum, particularly when they have the cart out on the weekend.

hx3KWyjL9R92ny_KW65oTw.text: Picked up a dim sum takeout order no utensils no napkins. Rating very low. Food just ok.

oBQdXZhbikRITKyoMpQ56Q.text: A good authentic place to get a good ole dim sum with actual carts being push around with 10/15 small plates ready to serve to you. Tapas style on wheel. I love it! I get to look, pick and they pull. It's fairly cheap per plate. Anywhere from $1.50 to $3.25 per small plate. Of course you can order something off the menu. Like we ordered the whole lobster made in a delicious sinfully yummy garlic sauce. Hot tea has a big flower in it so it's not jasmine tea. I also have notice their customer service have improved alot over the years. Not when they're alway soo busy on Sat/Sunday. If you just sit around and chit/chat, they will literally completely clean your table as a hint hint to show you, hey you got to go.. There's ppl waiting for your table. Lol.. I love this place.. Remind me of what I grew up with. And this is home.

photos.caption: Photo of Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster in garlic sauce

1zwiyxVoS9eV6QU0g2jOAw.text: If I could make it less than one star I would. I'm not from here and told several people at business that I was not familiar with it that it was my first time. No idea what to order. No one bothered to help me. Basically got charged 12 bucks for two cold egg rolls and a cup of water. Would not recommend this to anyone unless you go with someone who is familiar with how business is run.

IEO28SPXcld3cxzYHIQuww.text: Did not have the dim sum but I had the shrimp lo mein at lunch. Pretty good lo mein but not the best I've ever had. Not even top 5. About 30 minutes after eating I got a stomach ache and had to "pucker up" until work was over. In my opinion this place is over priced for the quality of the food.

ptWD_aOHDncUHAaXOM-O_w.text: I think I made a terrible mistake and ordered Americanized -Chinese food from a Dim Sum Restaurant.    We ordered two extra-crispy General Tso's Chicken with added rice (one white, one fried) and an egg roll. They do not serve combos here so our two entrees came to about $23. There was a lot of food - but it was a little pricier than some of the other fast food Chinese take-out places. I don't mind paying extra if it's tasty- and it really wasn't that much more in terms of price.   It was hands down the worst Chinese I have ever tasted. The rice had a rancid flavor - it smelled and tasted quite bad so my husband graciously offered his white rice to me. The base of fried rice is white rice so I doubt it was the rice itself but whatever they put in it was not appetizing. The chicken was soggy, sugary-sweet (tasted like a very spicey sweet and sour sauce, it was even bright red in color) ...it didn't taste like any General Tso's I have tasted before. I barely ate my dinner and because it was take-out I wasn't able to give management a chance to fix it unfortunately.   There were a couple of highlights ...the staff went the extra step to attempt to keep the crispy texture and did not sauce the chicken until we picked up our dinners, which was very thoughtful of her. They also have a really delicious homemade eggroll. It was oily but you know what it had actual meat and veggies inside of it and that made me happy.   Overall I just can't bring myself to come back for take-out, but I was told the Dim Sum on Sundays is delicious so I may give that a shot in six months once I forget about that rice that will haunt my dreams.

nzW_oNdr1yNN25EFAdh3aA.text: This restaurant has a new owner with new chefs and we are delighted with the quality of the food. The restaurant decor has had a makeover and the service is good and servers friendly. We have moved to Charlotte from the Washington DC area, where we frequently went to Chinese restaurants for dim sum. It is a very pleasant surprise that this restaurant is now as good as the ones in the D.C. area.

NtRMkhnisH4gi7hmFQHPDw.text: Reopened under new ownership.  Nice upgrades and very clean.  Staff was very friendly and offered their recommendations.  Food was delicious and priced well.

wIXs5-5tfOIXhPcWWlFUbA.text: Came here with some friends and experienced sub-par food and terrible service. First of all, the food came out really slow for a mid afternoon lunch and hardly any customers. Second, there was a really long hair coiled around a fried dumpling just under the skin and was clearly visible from the outside. I called over the waitress to bring it to her attention and she simply grabbed the plate and left. There was no apology or acknowledgement of the tainted food. We weren't sure if she was going to bring us a new batch or comp the charge so we just ended up waiting for an eternity before she came back.  She brought three new dumplings, but my group was too disgusted with the food and the service to even look at them. We asked for the check and another lady (I assume a manager) came to speak with us. She asked us if everything was okay and if there were any problems. She made it seem like the hair incident hadn't been brought to her attention so I mentioned that there was a hair in our food. She rudely answered that she already knew this. So...why did you ask us if we had any problems if you already knew about the issue?? Nevertheless, she gave us a thoughtless, mechanical apology and comped us for only one of the two orders of dumplings even though we didn't eat either of the orders.  All in all, I was extremely disappointed in the way they handled the situation and I will definitely not be back.

TErcXGJGbO3bNlcttmVvnQ.text: This is on,y the second time that I have had dim sum in my life ever so it's had for me to gauge the authenticity.  I can say that we were served warm plates of tasty stuff.  Came here hungry with a coupla buddies of mine and left completely comatosed.  It's been a week or so since I went so I dont' have a good recollection.  Sorry.  Too bad--Yelp! is more for me anyways :/  dmo out

-QY2tBnle860qhn-g_cfKg.text: Good service. Decent food for small towns. Overall experience was okay. However lobster ginger scallion for $62 was a bit pricey for this place. I would recommend if you haven't tried them dim sum to give it a go.

IcKYa0L4uD5HGy1kchGBHQ.text: Really pretty decent for CLT. Large selections and conveniently located on Central. The beef balls, shrimp and pork dim sum are all very delicious. I especially order congee with salt soaked duck eggs to go as I really enjoy them. The tea is hot, while not the best, is a good compliment to the dim sum. Yang chow fried rice and fried three precious are meeting with my expectations! The traffic is wild over the weekend and slow during the week except for dinner.  Always having plenty of parking around is a plus to the experience! :) will return again soon.

hYxK-Bpvv-vmc7hAzzgRFg.text: We ordered 6 small dishes. Chicken feet and shrimp dumpling are great! The pork bun is good too. They don't serve dessert like tart on weekdays. Overall good.

i59I5aCLZuZmQLDfyYgsVg.text: I've dined here several times and the dimsum is ok. It's definitely hit or miss here. Sometimes the food is nice and hot and other times the food is ice cold. This place isn't the best dimsum I've had but not the worse I've I've had either. Considering i don't have much dimsum options in CLT this place will have to suffice. I really wish CLT offered better dimsum options like NYC or Boston does.

-s5POJF2mLTo3GuXRB4-zQ.text: This dim sum is for real.  I'm mainly gonna rave about how I like the food.  The ambience is simple (like most Chinese restaurants I've ever seen) and it's True you will see a lot of Chinese people dining here, which is always a vote of confidence in my book.  You can also get take-out, which is usually what I do, and enjoy your gluttony in privacy.  So back to the food, after reminiscing a second.  Summertimes growing up we used to visit relatives in San Francisco and eat dim sum in Chinatown.  Short of traveling halfway around the world, I have to think that dining in a big-city Chinatown restaurant is about as authentic as it gets.  When I moved to Charlotte I was so happy to find a restaurant that served this cuisine and thought it was amazing--the variety, the authenticity, and the overwhelming yumminess!  But a part of me doubted my judgment since maybe my childhood pork bun memories are hazy.  Recently I went back to San Fran and had dim sum, lots of different dishes, and I thought, "Huh, this tastes exactly like the one in my neighborhood."  Score for Plaza Midwood and Charlotte!  So if you love dim sum, but have wondered if this could be any good, try it!

2D1xR6WgmZ_tr7In6nXWhQ.text: I was very sad when the original closed down but I think these guys are doing a great job. The menu is a little smaller but they still have all of my favorites! The food was just as good as the original dim sum and didn't take forever to come out like the other reviewers commented. Also, I don't eat pork and when a fried taro dish came out with pork in it the server I realized that I couldn't eat it, told me that it contained pork and then went and got me the same dish made with shrimp instead, which I appreciated.   I'll definitely be back!

G5PCj6I0MFF7pvn-xMmXsg.text: We went last 7-24-16, GREAT food, only thing is the wait, a table for 2 took 20 minutes, my wife was almost ready to leave, it wasn't busy, plenty of tables. Price is fair.

l11db4k0jr_p6tCT5VFxbw.text: I came in here with a big group before a show at the Fillmore. The waitress remembered everyone's orders and was even very helpful with menu selection suggestions. I adore dim sum and this was such a find! I would recommend it to anyone and will definitely eat here again.

wyOKgktfriKDLCUIsTZwrw.text: I would give this 0 star if I can.   We went in Sunday to start our day with some dim sums, since they are the freshest on Sunday. And they actually roll the dim sum in carts.  When we walked in, I can see they are very busy. And there's 3 pplz in front of us. The front lady asked us how many, after I told her 2 she just walk off seating a guy in front of us. She came back and start seating these 2 pplz came after us. And then another lady came to ask how many we have. While I was telling her 2 pplz, the previous walked back and seat these 4 pplz just walk in.  So I asked her is there supposed to be a line. She was like no, they seat according to table. I was like I understand if the table fit 10, then u don't want to use it for 2 pplz. However if the table fit 4, I expected to be seat before other pplz that just walk in.  The dim sum is not the best, but it'll do for Charlotte. It's just that lady just ruined my whole mood to eat there, so we walk out and decided to try Krazy Fish down the road.  Probably will not go back for a long while!!!

rIBiJ0cjkGfRf3kWjKglrg.text: Still one of the best dim sum place in my view. I've had plenty of dim sum in other cities before and most were alright. The servers here by far are always nicer than most place.  It's not stellar service but trust me, most Asian restaurants have horrible service and takes forever to bring small requests such as hot chili oil or just a water! Be prepared to come early on Sunday morning if you don't want to wait for a table since that's when they are busiest. They do serve dim sum during the weekdays but it's as ordered.

B39N9vx7P2xfjKBF_AT_Ew.text: Our family was visiting Charlotte and I had an enormous craving for dim sum.  Especially since the dim sum offerings in Pittsburgh leave quite a bit to be desired.  We stopped in on a weekday for lunch so that means that you can have dim sum if you want, but you have to order off a menu instead of picking off a steam cart.  The steam cart and the delicious desserts are for the weekends only.  Darn.  However, even though we had to order off the menu, everything ... and I mean EVERYTHING ... we ordered was delicious.  Not one clunker amongst the bunch.  So, here's what we ordered:  Siu Mai (pork and shrimp dumplings, steamed) Stuffed bean curd (fried tofu with shrimp) Pork bun (steamed)  Sharkfin dumpling - perfect Fried dumpling - also perfect Spring roll (chicken) - yep, perfect Sesame ball - my kids loved this  Again, everything we ordered was excellent and the service was quite attentive and cheerful.  Our pre-tip total came to $32 for our family of 4.  I wish I lived closer to this little gem of a place.  But for tourists who ended up here thanks to Yelp, this was a highlight for me on this trip!

ym0Bcw3BWCbs0deXLVZCCw.text: So, obviously, I'm one of those people who doesn't learn from their mistakes.  This time, instead of going into the restaurant for dim sum, we ordered Chinese takeout.  The soups were meh.  Neither the wonton nor the hot and sour soup had much flavor.    Next came the entrees.  For our family dinner night, we ordered Sesame Chicken, Orange Chicken, and Sweet & Sour Chicken entrees.  Neither of the kids cared much for the Sweet & Sour Chicken.  They said it "tasted funny."  They didn't even want to put on the sweet, sticky red sauce that came in a big container on the side.  And what kid doesn't love that?  That's never been an issue before.  My partner had the Orange Chicken which looked and tasted like chicken covered in the exact same red sweet & sour sauce.  He, too, was not thrilled.  Mine was the Sesame Chicken.  It, too, came in what looked like the EXACT SAME red sweet & sour sauce with a few (a very few) sesame seeds sprinkled on top.  I've never had Sesame Chicken that wasn't in a flavorful BROWN sauce and covered in sesame seeds.  Mine, too, was practically flavorless.  The accompanying rice they gave us was pretty dry and sticky.  Lastly, there were no fortune cookies to finish off a below-average meal.    To top it all off, the restaurant had apparently significantly raised the prices on everything since the last take-out menu we had on hand.  So, when picking up the order, we paid more than expected and the quality was practically non-existent.    Dim Sum is OFF our list FOREVER for both take-out and dine-in.  As our once-president once said, "Fool me once, shame on ... shame on you. Fool me... You can't get fooled again."

hAKQNRACjXGCG8MyFIDZuA.text: Growing up, I used to go here every Sunday, however stopped for 5 years and I finally made back couple of weeks ago. So, what's my thought?  I'm truly disappointed. Their dim sum wasn't fresh anymore. How would I know? 1. I inherited my parents' (my father used to be a chef) canine-like nose and taste, so I definitely know when something isn't fresh. 2. I've been to NYC and Atlanta, so if you want fresh dim sum then you have to try those places first and then tell me if Dim Sum is still good or not.   I'm not trying to be mean, but this place isn't authentic anymore. I think due to the change in clientele that this place americanized their dim sum.   I'm definitely will not be plan on going back for any reason. I think I'll stick with my random trips to Atlanta and get dim sum there.

1ze3nXy2XOO93quZbhwrbg.text: I learned quick you have to be aggressive here and demand people bring you food if you are ordering dim sum plates. I enjoyed the food and would return to try other items on the menu. We tried sliced pork, meatballs, shrimp noodle, shrimp and bacon wrap, fried dumpling, and something like oxtails.. I would recommend for those who are looking to try something new. It is definitely not Americanized so if you don't like traditional flavors then this place isn't for you.

_jIvshClu9pPuK6WSf9w4A.text: i just ate here for my first dim sum experience and it was not very good at all. we ordered the beef chow fun and about 7 items from the dim sum menu. everything we ate tasted very plain and kind of old. i'm also pretty sure the dumplings we got had raw meat inside but that's arguable. all around disappointing experience. the service was also rather slow and we were the only people in the restaurant for most of our meal. hopefully next time i have dim sum it will be a better experience. it definitely won't be here though

vPA-CCwiSkaN1ZoeN5bPuw.text: Fantastic authentic food and wonderful workers.  Such a gem in Charlotte! Beef Chow Fun and dim sum are really fantastic!!

sxdKc4-b-R3XTiyK2AUFqA.text: This place has reopened under new management and what a spectacular improvement.  While the remodeling improved the appearance what was most heartening was the improved quality of the dim sum!  What once was good was now great!  A nice variety of genuine just made dim sum.  And now they have added the traditional carts on the weekend which is the ideal way to graze and explore.  The dim sum is well priced although they do charge for the tea which is a slight annoyance.   The staff is enthusiastic and work hard to provide a good customer experience.  The parking in front of the testament is a tight squeeze so you might do better parking on the side. The previous management used to feature Peking Duck and I noticed it was no longer on the menu.  After such s great lunch I was thinking ahead to trying that.  The owner/manager when asked about this when I was at the cash register paying explained that sometimes the ducks wouldn't sell and the meat was to o dry to use the next day.  I only wish that they would let you order it 24 hours in advance.  I will suggest this next visit.  Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

1PbjRJT3JeYBcaVBiTju7Q.text: Sorry for the long review.  I have never been more mad about a restaurant experience.  This was my second time back at this restaurant.  I had a good experience the first time so we decided to come back because I love dim sum.  It's always hard to find a restaurant that serves authentic dim sum.  We came on mothers days, we knew that there would be some sort of wait but we did not expect the down right terrible experience.  Please keep in mind that the restaurant was half full and  we only saw two waitresses the whole time.  Our wait was over two hours and our order was not completed. The dim sum was not on a cart and instead it was ordered from a menu.  We ordered some dim sum plates and some regular plates like fried rice.  The waitress didn't even bother writing down our order.  I wrote our order on our paper menu and gave it to her.  It took 45 minutes for us to get water and this is only after I got up and notified the manager.  My seat was facing the kitchen so I could see them scooping our water out of a white painters bucket.  Then 1 hour and a half later some of the food arrived.  At the 2 hour mark we decided to leave and not wait on the rest of the food.  The waitresses were rude and had an attitude.  They told us that they had a large queue in front of us.  This would have been fine but we saw a couple come in after us and get served with drinks and food immediately.  During our time at the restaurant we watched several parties walk out, we heard complaints about the wait, dirty tables were not being cleaned, and complaints about the bills being wrong.  Our bill was wrong and the waitress at the cashier was insistent we got all of it.  Avoid at all cost.

8dR3UnCq5OXqBBi3UTXGbw.text: Awful service and food. I'm so disappointed with the female Chinese server with a short haircut. My boyfriend and I are Chinese and both of us noticed being treated differently at the restaurant comparing to the other Caucasian customers. She also brought me the wrong food. However, when I asked her about it, she blamed me for not explaining clearly while ordering. When my boyfriend wrote the tip, she stood right next to him and stared at the number he was about to put. The food was not fresh at all and I feel like they just purchased most food from an Asian market and warm it up in the kitchen. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!

GyM1MkEUqoQP9aLtJ4jU6g.text: Always excellent and cooked freshly on every visit.  Pan fried crispy noodles with seafood compliment the dim sum very well.  Service is always good with a friendly staff.

Q2sY_NgQ41Og2WPbZYG8zQ.text: Service is terrible food is terrible waitress tried adding fifteen percent gratuity with pen I told her that was not acceptable because the service was not great at all neither was the food. Would never come back again. Seriously go elsewhere place sucks

NQroIeqOzCjxquh7P70mIA.text: I reserved my comment as I'm real Chinese British  heritage from Hong Kong.  I've tons of Chinese cooking knowledge in the industry as well as I've many chances of traveling to LA.  I visited this place as my sister came out of state.   This place has changed management with a slight remodeling of the place to look nicer.  They served some of the dim sums that we could  have much more in any restaurants in LA.  The quality is ok!  I attached a price list for information in case those who are preparing to spend some good time there.

photos.caption: Photo of Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

Q928yXg3NhU3AnZsbwpDJw.text: What a comeback!!! We used to go to this restaurant in the past, but it closed down sometime in 2017. It was sad to hear they closed because the food and service were great! We found out they re-opened, and it's better than it was before! Clean dining room, same friendly staff, and delicious dishes!  We went on a Sunday afternoon and once we were seated, we immediately were greeted with a food cart with dim sum, steamed buns, fried calamari, and more! As you choose items from the cart, they make note on a piece of paper on your table.   Start by choosing a few items from the cart. As you finish those, they'll be back by to offer more, and you can choose as little or as much as your hunger tells you. When you're finished, simply take your ticket up to the front counter to pay.   I believe the food cart is a Sunday-only feature, but if you go during another time, you won't be disappointed with the standard menu!

oie3sKrpIm_Gpr4YQaACwg.text: I was disappointed with our trip here because it wasn't as good as I remembered before. I ordered five of my favorite dim sum and two were horrible. The shrimp dumplings tasted far too fishy as if the shrimp had turned and the beef balls were alright but not anything to rave over. We ordered probably ten items all together from the dim sum menu and only two were rave worthy. The service was wonderful despite the food being not so great.

3vLGnrUYvbHI8DzGL5jRaw.text: Service was great, but almost every dish we got was under-seasoned. Also, the downfall of having carts is that everything ends up lukewarm or cold by the time it hits your table. The siu mai was good though!

K3SUxB1KUqRx0UiQ8SQBGA.text: Yay, Dim Sum is open again! We were so happy to see this place reopened and most of the faces are very familiar. It was a happy little reunion at the restaurant this morning.  For starters, this place has a completely new look. I wish I had taken pictures of the interiors. It looks very nice and clean.  We went in for dim sum during brunch. Last weekend was their first weekend open and the wait was over an hour so we left and came back early today. We were promptly seated. The dim sum carts were rolling in very frequently and they had all of the good stuff - har dow, leek dumpling, shrimp balls, chicken feet, shrimp crepe, siu mai, Chinese broccoli etc. We got one of each (and two of the leek dumplings because they are SO good) and were happy to know the taste hadn't changed at all. The chili oil was also the good ol' kind that's made in-house and has been consistently amazing over the years. We also ordered the house special ho fun because that was our other favorite thing to order here, but that tasted different. Firstly it didn't have the beef-pork-chicken, but instead had shrimp and scallops. Also, it used to be a brown sauce with bok choy in it, but today's was a white sauce with asparagus. Oh well, it was still really good.  I am just happy that this place reopened. If you haven't been here yet, consider this your second chance and give it a try!

5h48fmNzD1DREUFyDOMt4A.text: Staff is very sweet, everyone is very accommodating. Everyone is full of smiles. The dim sum variety is huge and everything is perfectly seasoned. The reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is because the food wasn't hot enough (I bit into some cold pieces) and the tea cups needed to be washed better!

bFkbSdiwXOIDn_l4HOJhwQ.text: I LOVE this restaurant for Saturday/Sunday afternoon dim sum service.  I have never eaten here for a regular lunch or dinner - this review is specific to their dim sum service only.  Dim sum is a style of chinese cuisine served in bite-sized portions in small steamer dishes or on small plates.  Each dish usually comes with 3 - 4 pieces, ideal for sharing.    Dim Sum is located on Central Avenue.  When you first pull in the parking lot, you may have second thoughts. The lot is full of pot holes and the building is a non-descript concrete square.  But, if you continue looking around, you'll notice the parking lot is probably full and there may be a line out the door - this place is a treasure!  On Saturday and Sunday afternoons, they serve traditional dim sum service.  Once you are seated, be prepared for your meal to begin quickly.  Servers with carts will come around and offer you what is available.  They will lift the lid of each dish to show you the food, if you don't know what it is - just ask!    Each cart has a loose theme:    The steamer cart - full of steamed dumplings and buns.  From this cart, I really like to get the pork siu mai (shoo my) - open-topped dumpling with ground pork and spices; pork steamed bun - bready bun filled with savory pork and sauce; and the leek and shrimp dumplings - shrimp and leek in a fully enclosed dumpling.  You may also like the sticky rice - this is a bundle of rice with pork and chicken bits cooked in and wrapped in a lotus leaf.   From here you can also get steamed chicken feet and pork spare ribs.   The paste cart - this cart has shrimp and other meats that are wrapped in white, gelatinous noodles -- that look like paste.  I don't care for the texture of these items, so I wave this cart on.  The open-plate cart - this is my favorite!  On here you have items that are not steamed - they may be fried, pan seared or sauteed.  Hands-down favorite item is the stuffed eggplant with a fried shrimp mixture in it; I also like the leek dumpling and the taro root dumpling filled with pork and shrimp mixture.  The chinese brocolli, squid and spare ribs are also very good.   This is a delightful way to spend a Saturday or Sunday afternoon with family/friends.  Go, you won't be disappointed!

Photo of Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dim sum -

KSfiIzNP00fDi7x_4uq5-g.text: Went on a Sunday afternoon for Dim Sum @ Dim Sum.  Weekends are always fun, because they have the carts circling the restaurant and you get to pick and choose what you want.  This was my second time here and the first time I would have rated it a 3/5 as the food was all 'Okay' and on the greasy side.  Hit the spot, but wasn't anything special.  This past Sunday was my first time after they re-opened and I was much impressed.  FOOD - 4/5 - Good selection of dim sum and everything we had was somewhere between good and great.  This isn't "Best thing I've ever had" type food, it's more for comfort food (al beit not traditional), variety, and nostalgia.  We had the sticky rice wrapped in banana leaf (I think), shu mai, chicken feet, pork buns, roast duck, those shrimp rolls (the white ones that come with sauce), and pineapple buns.  The sticky rice, shrimp rolls, and duck were stand outs.  Duck is on the fatty side, which I prefer, but certainly a preference.  Pork buns were quite disappointing.  As a staple and the most approachable for non-dim sum eats, it was dry with very little filling.      Ambiance 4/5 (not that it's fancy, but it lives up to expectations) - The ambiance is exactly what I'd expect from a dim sum restaurant.  If I walk in to a dim sum place and I see Edison Bulbs and fancy tile work, I'm walking out.  This had everything I expect from dim sum:  drop ceilings, cheap metal framed chairs with vinyl cushions, and the push carts.    Price - 3/5 - Not expensive by any stretch, but most Charlotte restaurants can't push the volume to have low prices.  We paid about $41 for two people and we were full.  Service - 4/5 - Carts were prompt, no problem paying or getting a take out box.  As long as I get my food, service isn't that important to me at Dim Sum.

uRv9IrmurPygRc2a52hDwQ.text: This is very good Dim Sum. Unless you're going to Toronto, Washington DC or New York City it doesn't get better than this in North America. I am looking forward to my next visit!!

DWZVeuqWfBGLPxZAaiPNfA.text: Really enjoyed it. Although, they sell dim sum a la cart all day, Go on Saturday/ Sunday around brunch for the True dim sum experience with the carts.

h0SFK9VZqiS2MCTXInuK-A.text: Great food! Dumplings seemed to be fresh as well as the rest of the dim sum. Service was a little slow but that was fine since we were in no rush.

xvZDFzaT6KdSP1NJDzuFPQ.text: Is there service here?  We were sat right away but nobody came for a drink order. After a while, a cart passed w cold, greasy eggrolls. Another 10 minutes before another cart passed. The shrimp dumpling was awful, so was the shumai. Worst dim sum restaurant I've been to in 45 yrs.

l5Pgnyp_IwuoisMBpKf9Kg.text: There aren't many places for dim sum in the south.   A few tips- there is a wait list by the cash register. Write your name and party size down upon arriving.   The parking lot was packed on a recent weekend but we only waited about 20 minutes.   Dim sum comes around on carts. There were three different carts recently. All with different options. They do have a full Chinese food menu but you'll need to request it. You can ask what's in each dim sum or just be surprised.   You bring your yellow slip up front and pay there.   All in all not bad Chinese food for North Carolina. Tasted very similar so what I've had in Hong Kong and China. Prices are reasonable.

Gf6iEM-SVRINQXfVRfTimg.text: So I was pretty scared trying this place based on some of the prior reviews (smells of dirty dish rags, etc..) but I was pleasantly surprised at both the food, cleanliness, and service. No the dim sum is not as good as in San Fran or NYC china towns, but this is Charlotte ( I mean our claim to culinary fame is Price's Chicken coop). I personally thought the Shu Mai (shrimp and pork dumplings) were very comparable to what Ive had in San Fran, and the steamed pork buns were also very good. I was craving Dim Sum and this place did not let me down. I will say that I was hoping they would have a Dim Sum cart going around so you could pick and choose from what looked good, but they did have pictures alongside of some of the dim sum to help in the selection process.

XNODgwBDM5ugCLrhvc712A.text: I know this place is considered great by most, but we had a really really gross experience there.   So let me just say that the rating is more based on the experience then the actual quality of the food (I don't feel confident to judge the food since it was my first dim sum experience).  The menu and tables smelled strongly of dirty dish rags, and I think it was the patrons next to us that smelled like human excrement (not Dim Sum's fault, I know, but it makes it very difficult to maintain an appetite).  We ordered a variety of appetizers with the main courses to follow...  The appetizers were really mushy, and the combination of mushy food and the mix of dirty smells made both our stomachs upset, so we got the main courses boxed - we couldn't get out  of there fast enough.  I had a bite of the main courses at home but I threw out the food right after the first bite because I couldn't stop thinking about what just happened.  We will probably never return. The experience gets a two instead of a one because the waitress was very very nice.

5vIecE7r1u2KOizkuQ8cNQ.text: Ugh, this food is horrible. How can so many people like this place?!?!?! Went to dim sum here on a saturday morning and it was very empty. There were only about 3 carts going around and only went around ONCE.  I had to ask someone to come over and help us, but they only ended up bringing a specific plate over than the carts again. Oily stomach lining, slippery wontons....I feel like vomiting just writing about it.

c_cYjU0h7jNyRjy8YlROeQ.text: Loved the food! Lived in Asia for the most part of my life. This is one of the closest thing for a full Dimsum Chinese restaurant.

VUMUZEaqKimw2K-5oa7Tng.text: Go for Sunday lunch when the carts are being pushed around like race cars.  Bring the kids and turn them on to different food.  Try the leek dumplings and the salt and pepper calamari.  Tasty little suckers.  Not quite like being in Chinatown in NYC but for Charlotte, it's as close as you can get.  They celebrate Chinese New Year the first Sunday in February and two years ago, there was this evil white dude sitting on top of the restaurant throwing firecrackers down on the performers.  What the ?!?  But I guess he knew the owners because they saw him and let him keep doing it.  By the way, you can get in and out of this place in about 5 minutes.  Everything is super fast.  It gets really busy at around 12 noon on Sunday, so go a bit early or on the late side.  And the kiddies get free lollipops after the meal.

wT_WfgEDKOdI9IuESfPgOw.text: I came here while on a trip to NC!! Unforgettable because their hot and sour soup is UNLIKE any other!! I am obsessed over Hot & Sour soup so yeah...it DOESN'T really taste like hot & sour soup...but it IS SO good! 2.94$ for a small bowl, I really recommend it...It comes with the fried noodle you put in. BTW their fortune cookies they give out at the end doesn't have trans fat. Plus they were sooo good, unlike the typical fortune cookies given here in CA. I am not exaggerating .  Besides that, me and my friends got steamed buns...they were OK. Staff are super friendly and memorable, despite the fact that we just ordered soup and steamed buns and didn't take any recommendations (we had to eat steak in a few hrs so..). I wish I could try more things..the menu look so tasty and the soups tasted really high quality.  Would pay for an NC ticket again to come back!

YRcmJ6V_gVQddHWXkDJoFg.text: Before I went to China with a group from college we were brought here for the most authentic Chinese food Charlotte has to offer. Find a friend and make your way to Dim Sum!

r_gX9QtJRD0BRg84xlgDhg.text: Typical atmosphere. I had the Singapore noodles and the have tried 15 plus of the dim sum dumplings. They were all pretty good. I did not like the dim sum crepe it was to thick and slimy and I feel some kind guilt that they offer shark fin. Over all I recommend.

4kecyFb5aO9UVMRV95i8Hw.text: Two or Three Stars . . . oh me oh my. I have been coming to this place off and on for the past couple of years - more off in the last year. Of course, just coming back from LA, my expectation was much higher but even so, the food seems below par even with Charlotte standards. I went with two friends on a Saturday at around 1:30 PM. It was definitely too late for dim sum but we avoided the crowds because I have seen it packed on the weekends. Like some other reviewers, the place was not dressed to impressed but the service was okay. My two friends never had dim sum before so I was real excited to show off a piece of my culture . . . they weren't too impressed. Sucks!   So the fun thing about dim sum is being able to see the food on a cart before you order the items. There were only three carts in the restaurant and the workers seemed ready for a break because after coming by one time, they stopped and we have to wave at them to get them to come by.   The food was lukewarm which sucks because many of the items become oily such as the spare ribs and the Phoenix feet. The Sui Maai, and Ha Gaau were decent. The Ha Cheung was very good (my friend's favorite) but the Lo Mei Gai is a no go. The sesame balls were were worth ordering but the pineapple baau was so-so. The taste of everything was decent but perhaps because it was later in the day, it was not as fresh and hot as it should be. So I am going to have to go with a TWO because I've experienced better here.

GS_StyTxsaiyR2DRxsoq-w.text: Food is not stellar the atmosphere is kind of gloomy like eating in a basement. I haven't found another place in Charlotte that can beat this though, sad to say! The staff is decent, the ladies up front are really nice! It's a decent place if you are really desperate for some dim sum. They have a good selection in their menu too.

gLrktqo4-JaTBuW2FQkmLQ.text: You would be better off going to a Asian store and buying frozen dim sum. Price was ridiculous for dim sum and the area and quality totally not worth going! Was very disappointed . I have had plenty of Dim Sum all over the country. Would not recommend this to anyone who knows Dim Sum.

InTlxeQdwugDaJHwkaQQoQ.text: Since my wife introduced me to Dim Sum a few years ago, I've never been the same.  Case and point, was that we were traveling about 6 hours from VA to Chucktown, SC.  Earlier that week, I was on one of my internet hunts for Dim Sum in the Southeast.  I found this place and we HAD to stop.  It was little drive to get there, but worth it for us.  I don't know if we were hard up for Dim Sum, but this place was pretty good.  They have a ton of different things to choose from.  Char siu bao was good, some of the best around.  Definitely better than the frozen kind you get.

3JXH-t-bsxACum5H1P5IXQ.text: The food was great but the service was not all that great. It took us 15 minutes for an order for a cup of ice to be filled. The pork steam buns were great and I like the Orange Chicken, which seems to be a hard dish to find anyone else making. I'd go again but for take out instead of dining in.

Oz4BekePIS94JbzmhOg6Sg.text: I have yet to find a better Chinese restaurant in Charlotte.  I actually bought my house in the neighborhood because we kept passing the Dim Sum place and I asked the realtor "hey, what's up that street in front of the Dim Sum" and there was my house, For Sale By Owner, I'd never have found it if it weren't for Dim Sum.  And when I moved in and my refrigerator didn't get delivered for 10 days, they pretty much fed me daily.  I was hooked.  Five years later, I still go there all the time, and every friend or family member who comes to town gets taken there.  I've never had anything that wasn't good.  Dim Sum on Saturday and Sunday mornings, with the little carts going full steam, is of course the big draw, but you can order most of the little dim sum treats any time you come in there.  Every now and then the waitresses will tell me that I should try some special dish.  I got a lamb hotpot that way that I've never seen on the menu since.

yde8jITHLyhnMBm0WcZIeQ.text: Best dim sum in Charlotte. Nowhere else is comparable. Food is pretty good and fresh. Make sure to get there early on weekends BC there is always a line

PGQUB4anLoQAWHHmbxB-xA.text: Just because its in Plaza-Midwood doesn't make it super elite uber trendy.  The place is ok. I've read many rave reviews about it and I just didnt see. Being that I am Chinese, from Taiwan, and from Phila I know good Chinese.  i was expecting the world and just got slow service and average food.  The interior does look like an urban Chinese restaurant though.  It feels blands and dirty...

Utk0Uz4jZDjBMai5D_dj_g.text: So I use to eat here quite frequently but stopped since my palete has since expanded. So we went here today for a quickly. And we ordered the shiu mai which was a shrimp dumpling. Which is typically one of their best dishes. Let me tell you something, it sucked.... badly. Because you could tell it was not fresh. It looked like something they had previous steamed and it was left over that was resteemed. Second, the rest of their dumpling was just aokay. I order the fried crispy rice noodle crepe. And it eventually never made it out. The manager apologized profusely, which was very kind of her. But nonetheless it doesn't makeup for less than average dim sum. The weird thing is on the weekends, I feel like it tastes better because it is more fresh. And another pet peeve of mine is when the food comes out at different times. They literally brought the dish out one by one, with a freaking 5 minute interval in between.

mit8VS55j5w-tyAl3QD7nQ.text: The food gets no complaints from me.  When you can end up spending more there than in an overpriced San Francisco- Chinatown restaurant, something is really wrong!

AU5gkdAZed1RwSP2IE5MaQ.text: This place is not too bad for Charlotte.  I have been to Dragon Court and find them comparable.

KWd-5jMMs-Ptd1zc_eBPag.text: This place serves dim sum (like their name states) but that doesn't mean they offer good dim sum.  I think this place stays busy because of the lack of competition in the area for dim sum.  I've had better, much better for the same price in a variety of places around the nation.  I think their dinner service is slightly better than the dim sum.  If you want authentic Chinese food, you can pretty much order whatever you like here.  The food is pretty average but if you have a craving for something special and unique (like your mom or grandmother made for you), you could give it a shot here.

8Nic2F5j0CjowyrvAwtYPQ.text: Love my Dim Sum ! Have tried dim sum in LA, San Francisco, Seattle, Vancouver, NYC, Atlanta, Maryland, Minnesota, Orlando and Toronto. Definitely go on weekends. more so on Saturday when its freshest ! Enjoyed all the dumplings.

9wBpd-mndRtL3lqYkD0gMg.text: This place serves both dim sum and a regular menu, and I would have to say it's the best dim sum I've found in North Carolina.  They offer many great authentic dishes as well as some tamer, more Americanized options.  Great service too.  Lunch on Sundays can be very busy, but the staff works quickly to seat you as soon as possible.

XPWadbJSht25Ei5sUdeFwQ.text: Decent place for dim sum. I went for dinner on a Saturday night after a Panther's game.
