ge3_CzX4r-pupTghSBRl3A.text: I am so very sad to give this place one star. The pictures and reviews of this place looked so promising! Sadly, our experience from start to finish was not a good one. The food passed around the carts was cold- not luke warm but cold. Hope to be able to come back after they make some changes.

2KKcKSth8fpIbsbC6o_elw.text: Since last year, the quality of their dim sum has improved but the portions feel even smaller.

oBA-RWWp0TE4FO-MiR4cVQ.text: Fantastic. Ordered an assortment of dim sum and left fat and happy. Everything was delicious. I especially recommend the chicken feet.

bKzwSOokbkXp__XAJD7DIw.text: As I stepped off the plane  in Charlotte I had one thought on my mind... dumplings. I had recently attended a conference in Seattle (Podcon) and tried soup dumplings for the first time. My life was forever changed. But I was saddened to discover the Din Tai Fung only had 4 locations in the entire United States. None of those locations were on the east coast.   So it is with this pioneer spirit in mind that my wife and I set out to explore our local cuisine for some sort of substitute. I put "dumplings" into the Yelp! app and it returned with a few results. Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant was one of the first on the list. We went about 2 pm on a weekday and it was basically empty.  They have a menu with pictures of the various appetizer dishes that you check off and they bring them to you. We tried as much as we could fit into our stomachs before getting way too full. We had to bring the rest home. We ordered so much food and it still came to less than $50 for both of us.  A few days later our adventurous spirit returned and we found ourselves in Dim Sum once again. This time it was a Sunday afternoon and the experience was completely different.   The place was packed. Everyone was talking in languages we didn't understand with our ignorant American minds. When we sat down this time they brought around carts full of delicious foods already prepared. And we just picked which items we wanted off the cart and they put it right on the table. It was like a dim sum buffet that comes around to your table.   We tried all sorts of things we'd never had before. Even Chicken Feet. What do chicken feet taste like? Chicken. The wait staff was attentive and made sure we knew what we were ordering if we had any questions. This place felt so authentic to the Asian community that I felt like a tourist in my own city. Thank you Dim Sum staff for welcoming us into your home.  I love this place and will definitely return.

Photo of Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Foot!
Photo of Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious treats

yBEAoQvwuT5KDe6rm0PuxA.text: I went back  because I enjoyed my previous meal.  Lunch was horrible.   Spring roll was cold.  2nd spring roll had nothing in it and was cold.  The oil was not hot enough.   My shrimp dish was mostly clerery.   Must have hit it on a good night the first time.  Tried this place many years ago and boy has it changed.  Nice and clean with a solid sanitation score.  Wanted to try something authentic so gave it another try.  I got the beef chow fun and it was delicious.   I ate every bit.  Can't wait to try another Cantonese dish.

WvhcOsTDJRknC9_FfTOCcg.text: Still the best dim sum place in Charlotte (there is only another place to offer dim sum menu, but by far this is the best). Back a couple years ago, I would not recommend this place, then it changed ownership and it got worse. Fortunately, the current owner made serious investment and this place was renovated I think about a year ago and it now becomes a much better place. Better and more consistent food quality, improved service and to top it all, a cleaner and much improved atmosphere. From the outside it may look the same but once you are inside, you can feel the coziness of the place. we went for brunch with the traditional dim sum menu. The only thing I feel they should do is to serve congee/porridge. That's a major item that I miss in this dimsum place, otherwise, the rest of the item was great.

t1mSl5ycxCFJyaAMXCsJTw.text: Oh mercy! This place has fabulous food and service. We took my daughter for her birthday and she ordered about 1 or 2 of everything. We had a few to go boxes. Amazing they warmed up superbly for another amazing treat the next day. Cant wait to go again. Please go there and enjoy this most excellent treasure of delicious dim sum!

eBo9hS3EJQ7ttFh-AfRroQ.text: Im not charlotte native so I did come into this restaurant with some expectations. While trying to be fair, we've tried: shiu mai, bbq pork bun, shrimp rice wrap, general tso chicken, and mapo tofu. First of all shiu mai and bbq pork bun came out first. Their meat... you can smell the stink-ness of the meat. We gave up eating those and tried to give other entrees chances. All the food were just smelled really bad and our experience were not the best.   The service: 2/5  There were two waitresses and they werent the nicest. They kept speaking in chinese and we were so clueless. We can tell there were so clashes between those waitresses fighting over us. It was unpleasant. We wont go back until they fix their customer services and their meat.

XI27WeCsxRWvAGsNR-B7sg.text: First I don't write review often, only if those restaurants are really great or pretty bad. This DIM SUM Restaurant is the Worst I ever had. I had a FRIED FLY!!!!! in one of my meal. I called the waitress. The waitress took a picture of that meal and took away quickly. Everything seemed to be fine at that time. I was still regreting for not taking the picture as proof. The waitress that served me is a mid-age asian lady with short hair. She took off 3 dollars for that dish I ordered and didn't even say sorry. She said "that dish is the only one has a fly, if you get a fly in every of your meal, you can eat for free." WTF??? Please imagine about the tone she used and that really pissed me off. I asked for the picture of the FRIED FLY as a proof since I want to write this review. She said"I am calling the police." WHAT???? Did I demand something that unrealistic? I paid everything for that meal except that FLY. I even willing to pay 5 dollars for that DELICIOUS FLY if I can get a picture of that. They refused.  If you want to eat Chinese meals and unfortunatly walk into this one. God bless you.  A review wrote on toilet.

uDisKJWgGSWV6PSZ4m7IpA.text: I was in Charlotte with a few friends and we decided to come here for dim sum! The restaurant  was recently renovated, so it's very spacious and clean.   Since we went on a weekday, they didn't have dim sum carts going around. However, I was happy to see that their menu for dim sum had pictures! Since I don't eat dim sum too often, I never really know what to order so having pictures helped us a lot.   Between the three of us, we ordered 2 dishes (1 vegetable + 1 noodle entree) and 9 dim sums ($3.50 each). We had leftovers from the dishes because the dumplings we ordered filled us up. I definitely recommend their beef chow fun.   Service was decent and food came out within a reasonable time. I will be back!

1I-E4nazJktPPdCt1xuCpA.text: I have visited this resturant numerous times and was never disappointed. Usually I have come with my Asian friend and he did all of the ordering. One time he wasn't available so I ventured out with my girlfriend I was a little nervous at first but as soon as I set down and the carts started rolling by I was at home! My favorites are the chive dumplings and the veggies with the oyster sauce!

1XmRkixDaf4Nb22ocxUXHA.text: I was really excited to try Dim Sum, but was quite underwhelmed by the food. I wouldn't really care to order anything that I got again. On the positive side, the service was quick, the staff was friendly, they do a great job of walking you through the menu items if you are a first timer, and the menu has pictures for everything.

TwYLlwIk4yaT3CcteDmAlA.text: I was saddened and disappointed with this place, although wanted to try it for some time as it's the only dim sum around.    I went on Christmas Day and it was busy, but not too bad. We were seated right away and greeted to put our order in.  I ordered crab rangoon, pork bun, steamed dumplings and egg drop soup.  Sadly, I only liked the pork bun.  The rangoon was terribly rich.  Greasy, creamy and rich. I could only have one, and with that, felt ill.  The dumplings were just ok.  The came with sauce on top, nothing to dip...and a HUGE wad of meat inside...might be good for someone, ugh...but not me.  The egg drop soup had an odd flavor and I only ate one bite.  The pork bun was good.  Tasty meat inside, just the right amount and perfect bun.  The restroom was hideously dirty.  I mean disgusting!  Avoid it at all costs.  The overall restaurant was not bad...it looked clean and pretty organized.    The service was good.  The prices were entirely ridiculous for what you got. I spent over $30 on appetizers that is disliked.  Will probably not come back, but you live and you learn.

OSLKtkGCTGljclHk7MbRXQ.text: Nice little dim sum spot when that craving hits. The waitresses were very nice and catered even to my little two year old. Would definitely recommend this place and come back--no frills just good food!

r0HOwqteGMYTQpOM8Ie_QQ.text: I like tapas. I like dim sum. I am a man that likes variety.   Normally breakfast/brunch is crowded as heck, so we waited a little to grab food. 2pm was perfect. No carts, but the dim sum came out faaaast and it was hot and fresh.   Dim Sum is pretty yum. Overall this place is a little pricey though. One of my favorite dishes, Chinese Broccoli (Chinese broccoli sauteed with oyster sauce, or garlic sauce) was $9.95.   I still haven't seen the bano here, but the dining area looks pretty clean.

RfO8BrPLNGIIqSnKl96LIQ.text: I've been in Charlotte for almost a month now, and have only experienced one great disappointment: that there are only two dim sum restaurants in the entirety, AND that they're both half an hour away from me. Why, Dim Sum? Why?  Now it seems besides the Dragon Court (which doesn't seem to be wowing people either), the Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant is all I have left. Le sigh.   Alright, lament aside and review on, this place did not dress to impress. Outside looked pretty sketch, and upon walking in there, the cook and what looked like the manager were sitting down watching tv. They seemed to be able to afford the down time because there wasn't a soul in the house. I waited awkwardly by the counter, then said, "Excuse me," three times to no avail. Then suddenly, for some reason, the chef looked up, barked something and a waitress came out with my order.  First things first: if you are a full-time Dim Sum restaurant, you need to have some staples that come with availability. All sweet items are done ONLY on weekends. This includes the custard tarts, coconut rolls, fried pineapple rolls, ANYTHING that resembles a dessert, and one of the biggest staples of dim sum and one of my personal favorites, zha leung cheung fun, also known as Chinese fried dough wrapped in rice noodle. I know how this may sound, but for those of you who have experienced a good zha leung cheung fun, you know what I'm talkin'bout.   That taken off my order, I almost decided to wait for the weekend, BUT I was only 15 out of the thirty minutes away in a car with no air conditioning - I may as well tough the damn thing out. Also up on the list: pork and shrimp dumplings, fried shrimp balls, and chicken feet.   This is my usual dim sum test. Something I like and is easy (dumplings), something I hadn't tried before (shrimp balls), and... the feet. You can always tell how good a dim sum place is going to be by their chicken feet. In this case, the chicken feet were cooked moderately well, but had no seasoning whatsoever and what little sauce there was was very bland. The meat in the dumplings tasted good, but had an odd texture of not ground, but pureed. It took me a couple to get used to it. The shrimp balls were huge, and delicious. However, the outside was soggy instead of the crunchy I was hoping for.   All in all, hoping for a better dim sum experience. Now all I can do is place my hope in the Dragon Court. Wish me luck.

The menu items looked really good as they were being delivered to the tables around us--not your typical Americanized deep fried stuff. I'll be going back for sure.

CGG4435-n4H-iOUgcg0DOA.text: Best dimsum in town..i don't know why this page is noted as closed?   I've been craving and hunting for a "traditional" dim sum spot in town since moving from NY. After trying many, this one is worth the raving review. A little more expensive then I am used to from.back home, but it's worth the taste.  These are my go to grabs from the cart: - Chinese Broccoli (ask for extra sauce) - Fried Taro - Shumai (shrimp, but all are good) - Fried Tofu w/shrimp - Shrimp in rice noodle (beef is good too) - Pork BBQ - sticky rice in lotus leaf  As for a tea: go for a traditional  Chrysanthemum tea (flower tea).  Service is quick, i've been seated right away all the time so far. Staff is friendly and they come around frequently and even grab you a dish they may not have on the cart, if you ask.  Lots of parking, but depending what way you drive down on central the sign / marquee is hard to see, you gotta know where you turn.

kPub_DVTW4C_cjPgics7CQ.text: I finally dragged my hubby and son to try some Dim Sum...and well!  We hit the restaurant during the peak hours, at around 6:30 pm, and there were only about 3 tables full...so no wait.   Unfortunately, some disappointments. Realized that they only feature traveling Dim Sum carts during brunch hours on Saturday and Sunday...not in the evenings! Sadly, we had to order strictly from the menu, which also seemed smaller than usual (?). Then, when my son wanted to order the Beef Teriyaki off the regular menu, he was told that they were out of that apps. They were also out of one of my Dim Sum of choice. Also, except for their Eggplant Dim Sum, there was no other veggie Dim Sum...so we ended up eating a ton of carbos and proteins.   Most of the Dim Sum tasted pretty good...at least for me. My husband complained a bit about the texture of some Dim Sum (too oooey gooey doughy?), and my finicky son didn't even try all the Dim Sum ordered. So no, they weren't thrilled with the foods, but liked it OK. At least they now have tried Dim Sum.  Service was fairly quick...and generally better than last time I was here (with a big group of friends). However, in order to get tea refills or napkins or whatever, you have to flag down the lone waitress (or the manager/owner) on duty.   The place also seemed cleaner and cooler (AC, that is!) than last time, but just like last time, very lackluster and bland. First of all, it's just way too quiet...almost dead silent, minus the sound of silverware. They definitely need some overhead music! Also, like I might have mentioned last time, the place could use some color...and more wall decor. I just thought that the overall ambiance was too boring with its beige/ivory walls and the most barest of decorations.  Lastly, the bill. The items we ordered weren't fully listed, but just the number of items (which, frankly, we haven't kept track of...so who knows if the listing was even accurate??). Well, thankfully, the pricing of Dim Sum wasn't too bad, especially for the tremendous amount of foods we had. I did learn that next time, I need to keep better track of everything we ordered and received, as well as billed.     Overall, it was just OK at best. Like I said, the place wasn't conducive to a thrilling experience and the Dim Sum options weren't optimal (no carts even!). Still, this is the only full scale Dim Sum restaurant in Charlotte. I personally LOVE Dim Sum, so am glad they're here. Guess now I know not to go for Dim Sum in the evenings.

09Dwr3YHPA4lcrt4fdIEkw.text: Three stars on Yelp supposedly means "A-OK," which sounds like a wonderful compliment.  But Yelp is all about grade inflation, and the reality is that an overall three-star rating on Yelp puts a restaurant easily below Yelp par.  It means that the restaurant is getting hammered by way too many one-and-two-star reviews, which obviously means it's displeasing quite a few people.   Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant currently has a three-star rating.  Ouch.  That almost steered us somewhere else, but we wanted dim sum and this apparently is the only formal sit-down dim sum game in town.  Plus, neither of us had been to dim sum in way too long, even though it's a food experience I almost always love.  So when I say I was pleasantly surprised by Dim Sum and its dim sum, it was against this dubious background.    The restaurant looks a little seedy from the outside, but the interior is sharp and clean enough.  The low ceilings might bring out the claustrophobia in a few folks.  We were seated at a corner table, which initially seemed like a disaster because the carts weren't making it back there for the first 15 or 20 minutes.    But when they did, most of the dim sum we ordered was pretty satisfying.  All the stuff in the steel steamer baskets--turnip cakes, various dumplings (har gow, a chive dumpling, and one or two other porky ones), shrimp rice noodle roll, sticky rice--seemed like it was at least was piping hot, seemed fresh enough, and was at least of average dim-sum quality (and least when you're talking about a metro like Charlotte that's not well represented by Chinese food).  And even average means that I'm pretty satisfied when it comes to dim sum.  Unfortunately, the stuff not in steamer baskets--Chinese broccoli and some pan-fried or griddled pot-stickers--was room temperature or colder.  Not good.    We ate a lot, and our check was over 40 bucks, which is actually a bit high for dim sum.  When you talk about the amount of protein and preparation involved in dim sum, though, people's expectations about dim sum prices are pretty unreasonable when you get right down to it.  3.5 stars, rounded up.

GOybAbNWocoxIClHEkgSLA.text: Didn't take long for this place to go downhill.   The food was cold in the carts. They know it's cold and don't care. You don't even get a menu to choose from. You get what's going around in multiple cycles in the carts.   The service was horrible. There's one lady who is always there and she's always amazing but the rest of the staff is horrible. Asked for a bowl of rice. Never got it. No one came by to ask how we were doing. Asked for black vinegar - said they don't have it. Then the ONE lady worth anything gave me the black vinegar that I know they had. The staff is much younger than before and I overheard their conversations about school, homework and gossip. Went to checkout and there's no greeting from the girl at the register. Nothing but a bored face waiting for us to hurry up and leave so they could get back to gossiping.   The ONE lady who has always worked there is the only reason they got two stars instead of one. Never coming back here. I hope management smartens up and does some quality hiring.

v_dokkV-IDPo581bBHdtHQ.text: I was not impressed. A hole in the wall restaurant. Food was nothing spectacular...your usual Chinese cuisine. My friends ordered a bunch of small plates and I ordered the tangerine chicken. They both enjoyed my meal more than what they ordered. Bathrooms were dirty...hair in the sink and a bug crawling nearby. I won't be making another visit.

hOKibDTDDMRwPPbqx2GhHg.text: Food is pretty good. At first. Being from the northeast it's almost impossible to get good Chinese food around here. sSGk87EGBJg8FSVDHDkhww.text: Not sure why all the negative reviews. I've had dim sum all over New York, Chicago, San Francisco, and other cities. I thought it was great and the service was very friendly. Try it!

EM6B7-uIw-d3-gtlU1uEig.text: So, the pictures looked appealing for this Dim Sum restaurant but though the food looked as it should, it sure did not taste right.    First off, what a mess when it comes to getting a table.  We walked in and there were 10 or more open tables. 7 or more of those tables were dirty with one girl bussing tables very inefficiently (I worked in a Chinese restaurant from age 8 to adulthood, so I would know).  They would randomly seat parties of 3 at large 6 top tables and and make larger tables wait while there were plenty of tables for 2-4 people.  Very confusing.   The food was very disappointing.  Having grown up on dim sum food, I wasn't expecting the best from this restaurant but I sure wasn't expecting the worst.  This place was probably one of the worst I've been to in my lifetime.  The staples like Har Gow (shrimp dumplings), Pork Shu Mai (pork dumplings), Chong Fan (rice noodle roll) and Egg Custard all lacked flavor.  The Chong Fan, Chinese Broccoli and Turnip Cake were cold.  They weren't even lukewarm.  Simply cold.  The sauce on the Chinese Broccoli was extremely watered down as if they put oyster sauce with water and thickened it up with corn starch.  Not right.  The Turnip Cake was too cold to taste good and the Beef Chong Fan was cold and very firm with no flavor at all.  Everything else we ordered lacked flavor.  The only decent dishes were the Sticky Rice wrapped in Banana Leaf and the Cha-Sui Bao (BBQ Pork Buns).  The egg custard had the right texture and flaky crust but the custard itself also seemed watered down.  Very sad.   Service wasn't good, we saw our waitress a couple times during our entire visit and ended up asking the help of other staff for assistance.  Will I go back? No.  Would I recommend to anyone? No.  But hey at least I can say I gave it a try.

Uv-fqanuPGPM93kGkW6wXA.text: I grew up eating dim sum and this place is serving partially frozen food microwaved prepared food and cold dishes when dim sum is supposed to be served fresh and hot.   The staff are extremely friendly, but unfortunately this place was not worth your money. We paid $43 for three people, we ordered 9-10 dishes. Though the staff is friendly, the food is definitely not worth a cent. You can go to the closest Asian market and buy better frozen dimsum that what you get at this restaurant.  I'm extremely disappointed with the quality of the food. The food was cold and dry. We got there, ordered, ate and within 10-15 minutes we bolted out.   We couldn't wait to get out!!

UeemfB5zgOxf7M1hHthnUA.text: The food is good, I like to eat here when I come up to Charlotte.  But, the bathrooms are a different story.  The women's bathroom is strange, there is a stall with no door, and two normal stalls.  But other than that, it's pretty good overall.

3oMb8CNVL248b-l5XMiLag.text: I saw a 3-star rating prior to visiting this restaurant. However, I still visted after seeing fellow reviewers saying management has changed. I did notice some saying the food is still bland, but I really wanted Dim Sum and decided to give this place a chance.  I was not impressed with the Dim Sum food. It is not horrible, but it is nothing special. Neither the flavor nor the texture impressed me. Houston's Dim Sum is much better. However, I did enjoy the Seafood Fried Noodle dish. It was so delicious, filling, crunchy, and saucy.  The service: My family and I were seated after standing around aimlessly for a bit. There was one server standing behind a table who looked up at us when we walked in then ignored us. All of the servers pushing carts were nice except for one... we asked for fried calarmi, she didn't put it on our table or mark it on our card, and when we repeated that we wanted it, she -- visibly annoyed -- said "I thought you said you didn't want it!!!" Why would we repeat our request if we didn't want it? She impatiently placed it on our table, marked it on our card, then stormed off... is it that serious? Please listen to your customers instead of engaging in unnecessary interactions. We would like to eat in peace... everyone else was kind.  Prices are decent. I came with two family members and our bill was $27 prior to tipping: $15 of our bill was from the Seafood Fried Noodle dish and $12 was from Dim Sum. We got a decent amount of Dim Sum, so the food portion to price ratio is good.  We will most likely be looking elsewhere mainly for the lack of flavor in the food. Service can also be improved.

KuueYJu8gbsB0LKfTXSnaw.text: It has been several years since we've been to this restaurant, in fact when my eldest daughter was in Charlotte for a job interview but since it was during her fall break and on her birthday, we planned to come here since there were/are not many Chinese restaurants that have dim sum.  A group of us were in Charlotte to visit the Billy Graham Library.  We were quite hungry and decided to come here.  FYI - some of the guys are not that adventurous or have a diverse culinary palate.    We arrived and I noticed the lobby was renovated and looked nicer.  We were pleased to see the dim sum carts!  But it was before 3 pm.  Unfortunately since we got there toward the end, the baked pork buns we got were cold along with the siu mai and other dumplings and there other dishes we wanted to order.  We ordered off the menu but were now considered dinner prices since shift change.  Two of the guys ordered lo mein and beef and broccoli though they all did like the pork buns.  Hubby had gotten the beef rice noodles and pork rice noodles along with the beef balls, pork ribs, etc.  If we got there early, perhaps the food would have been better due to temperature.  It was great to see authentic dim sum

_44FSI-yOygTsVJa4hYT-g.text: Wanted to find out good Dim Sum place as I moved in Charlotte recently. Turned out just fine, I expected more from a 3 and a half star review restaurant.

EyjZgP0wvy9pWGVwFcZ9tA.text: Beware - super ghetto.  Fortunately the food is pretty good.  Things to try: ma po tofu, salt and pepper squid, black beans clams, and the lobster.  The rice could be better quality, along with the crysantymum tea...I think I had bugs in mine the last time.  But the food is tasty enough to come back.

6DNQpuDWQ87ypROSNeBQ_A.text: I was told I *needed* to come here and get dim sum as soon as I got into town. Never one to turn down tasty Chinese foods, my cousin and I met up with two friends for lunch.  Our friend, a regular at this place, put himself in charge of ordering dim sum for all of us. Knowing he knew his stuff and also too lazy to care, we trusted him. He ordered shrimp shu mai, fried taro dumplings, fried pork dumplings, chicken and pork buns, taro shrimp, and stuffed eggplant.  The fried pork dumplings were much bigger than the ones I'm used to from Prosperity Dumpling back home, but still good. The wrappers were still thin and the filling was legit. I enjoyed the stuffed eggplant, and the shu mai was okay (I am not a huge fan of shrimp shu mai for whatever reason).   Despite that goodness, our meal was a bit disappointing. We asked for chili oil and were told they were out. Needless to say, everyone at the table was upset. Even if they made their own and ran out somehow, they could have hit up any of the 373958 Asian markets on Central (like the one next door!) to get a temporary supply. Later, we learned they did not have any chicken and pork buns, so were given regular pork buns as a substitute. Our taro dumplings, which I usually love, were crispy, but were not cooked through. My friend mused that his was cold. I bit into mine and upon first bite, nearly burnt the roof of my mouth. However, my next bite was lukewarm.   The prices here were okay and the service was good, but I felt it didn't live up to the hype. I would like to give it another chance, but I'm not going to go out of my way to get back there when there are so many other places to eat in this city.

-Exg1j62BJBB6tDNQrwRyw.text: Driving back to Atlanta from RTP with Colleagues from Asia and they really wanted Chinese.  These guy feed me like a king when I am on their turf so the pressure was on. PF Chang was not really what they needed so I hit yelp and one of the other guys pulled Trip Advisor and he found this place.  We ordered 5 Dim Sum dishes, all stuff that couldn't have been bought frozen. All great.  Ordered Singapore Curried Noodles and a crazy large serving of Seafood Hor Fun. Both where fantastic. Also had a couple simple veg dishes that where Wok'd just right.  The place is not very appealing from the street. When you get inside it is very old school Chinese and pretty dated but I like it that way. The d'core was just like most of the places we eat in in South China and South East Asia.  My friends loved the food and especially the authenticity. They liked having "real" food for breakfast too. Like I said the Hor Fun was really big!!!!!  If you want a fancy setting go to PF Chang. If you want really authentic and high quality Dim Sum and Cantonese Chinese, this is the place.  It is in my GPS now for my next trip to RTP.

68A0cY9qsPbBfHnY0YhNzA.text: A friend and I visited on a Tuesday afternoon for some Dim Sum. Finally found what I was looking for, some TRUE chinese food (although I was disappointed to see orange chicken on the menu... what a shame). We tried the lotus cakes, steamed pork buns, chicken feet, tripe, shrimp rice noodle crepe, and shui mai. The lotus cakes were delicious as were the steamed pork buns, shrimp rice noodle crepe, and shui mai. The black bean sauce on the chicken feet was good, but I personally think chicken feet are too much of a hassle to eat. This is the first time I have ever had tripe and I will say I am not a fan! But, that is nothing against the way Dim Sum makes it. Overall I will return to satisfy my urge for some chinese food.

D5OGIHQHhUJOYpcSqpKc0Q.text: I went  on Sunday with My son. I arrived about 11:25 there were three group ahead of us ,no problem .They have You sign in yourself on the back of take out menu and stand around the register/front door..After 20 minutes the groups were seated so we were next about then  a couple came in and signed in then in minutes they were seated ahead us  so after standing for 25 minutes we left. I called and told them they needed a better system ,like a maybe they write the name or  give you a number ..disappointing

i4zkHhy2BT3l7jaGxgi1HA.text: This place was great! I was highly impressed with the quality and variety of dim sum offered. The atmosphere was clean compared to your typical dim sum house. I feel Charlotte is very fortunate to have this gem. The location is kind of sketchy but everything within the walls of the establishment definitely make up for the area it is in. I will be back!

vFI-ASLhSIDFsWsZ6UzS-A.text: Too greasy for me. But overall, not too bad. The staff was friendly and there's not that many options around here for dim sum. I will admit I've had better..but for NC, it'll do.

9jRXtNttEr9_x9psk-X8hg.text: My wife is Chinese and I lived in Hong Kong for seven years.  We are so pleased that there's good dim sum in Charlotte at the "Dim Sum" restaurant. If you go at the weekend there's a good selection and it's served from carts to your table. The chicken feet with black bean cause is one of our favourites, the shrimp dumplings (Har Gow) are pretty good. All in all if you can't get to New York or the west coast this is as good as you'll get. The staff are extremely friendly and if there's a line out the door it's worth joining it.

zz_xhOdzIXCTSUTN6bAhYQ.text: Food: Lots of dim sum favorites like cheung fan, lo mai gai, har gau, siu mai.  Decor: Low ceiling, uneven flooring, cluttered feel.  Service: Lots of staff to help make the right choices, score the right dishes, and clean up after.  Friendly and eager to help.  Location: Close enough to uptown for lunch. Just a quick drive.

dpmuOSE883J4z-D7LpWlpw.text: Great dim sum place. My fiance and I always come to eat here whenever we've got the chance passing by charlotte. The roasted duck is great! It's a good Togo to take home for dinner.

BTZlxEytWVunhwIhX-urbw.text: When you walk in it smells dirty, looks dirty and old. The food is "OK". For the dim sum aficionados it might be good, but I won't go again just because of how dirty it looks. If the outside feels looks run down, I can't imagine the kitchen.

-O7uKHEdmAebhK_xXJw_vw.text: Decent vegetarian options, somewhat interesting flavors, but for the most part, feels like there's something missing.    Ma Po Tofu was a souped-up (no pun intended) version of whatever-in black bean sauce. Hot and Sour soup was somewhat impressive, black vinegar flavor shining through, and it wasn't a problem to keep the pork out (which means they're not making it at 10am and letting it sit for umpteen hours). Greens (bok choy, choy sum, etc) are delicious here. Flecks of browned garlic abounding, yay!   But if you're looking for veggie-friendly Dim Sum, you'll need to make special plans. When I inquired, I was told it wouldn't be a problem with a week's notice and a large-ish guest list.    Prices are a bit high, but the staff are sweet and the veg selection good enough to keep me interested.

photos.caption: Photo of Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. dim sum menu

AwYGdNUIdZPtCklcPcExZA.text: Came in last night and at first i was a little skeptical but the lady's here are so sweet! The decor is nothing great but I defiantly think it's worth a trip!  So i had come here first (yelp)  to check out the reviews and to see what everyone had liked. So I tried to order some of that to round out our meal. We had ordered a bunch off of the Dim Sum menu and then per Pourinas recommendation had the Chinese Broccoli with the Garlic sauce-Delicious and Fresh it has gone up in price $1 i think but they let you know that upon ordering I was totally fine with it though. Other favorites were the Won Ton Soup- the Won Tons were so good I got one to go for lunch today :) . I also really liked the Taro Shrimp with a lil Soy sauce on them. The Shrimp Dumpling were great along with the Pork Dumplings (HUGE). We had the Sesame Balls which the server said was basically they're dessert during the week because the others aren't served till the weekend...I will be back for more!   My not so favorite but not at any fault of the cooks but because I had never had them before and the texture was all wrong in my mouth I found it hard to swallow...The Turnip Cakes. They were just kinda gooey and a very strange taste if only you could've seen my face...Priceless. We also had the Pork Steamed Buns and also the Steamed Buns with Chicken and Pork....I'm not sure how I felt about them because they came last to the table and I was already getting full so I really only had a bite of each and the only complaint would be that they're was too much bread around the meat but the flavor seemed to be good.  I would say we had a great dinner and we will definitely be back perhaps with others so we can try more! Our server told us to come in on the weekends to take advantage of the carts going around so that we can pick out what we want based on the way they look too! I'm down for this Saturday just so I can have more!!

xVrqWVnY3AtCIDHXgxqNTw.text: Been coming here for years, always been a fan of the sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaf. The service and quality have always been at or above our expectations, and we've had dim sum in larger cities across the US for many years.  We ate here again today for brunch and were inspired to write a review after another great experience.

eSc70qcgx3NApbavMiovVQ.text: Dim sum was ok.  Chung Funn was not good.

Jy18ZPJZGOZ5fHCjcbh9ug.text: Went here for my birthday dinner, it was better than the best !!!!!!!! I really cannot understand some critical reviews. I am a frequent traveler to China, and I think they have perfectly blended American Chinese and "real" Chinese food. Great, patient, knowledgeable server, timely delivery of food, nice presentation, at a reasonable price. I am a huge fan of Dim Sum. Christina

FZJggcAhBQI0-FwhvnWccw.text: I've been coming here for many years and at last I'm writing my first review.  My first Dim Sum experience was Mirawa in LA's Chinatown. The bar was set high because of that most excellent experience.  Since then I've had Dim Sum in San Francisco, New York and DC.  This place is a Charlotte highlight. CAUTION...if you attempt to compare this place to experiences in larger cities you'll be disappointed. Enjoy it for what it is, Dim Sum in the CLT.  The food is authentic, fresh and affordable. During the week you  can order Dim Sum style from the menu. On the weekends they roll the carts with traditional fare.  Shaomi, har gow and char siu bau are all excellent. I would also recommend the chicken, pork or shrimp fried rice.  The tea is fair to average. We asked for Jasmine but it wasn't quite up to par.  You will get excellent service any time but expect a wait on weekends.  They have recently upgraded the carpet and fixtures. Business is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. mural from parking lot

eahIeYyMHi9LqHCiMv52Mg.text: Pricy place for just a mediocre dim sum place. There were 3 of us, and I have never eaten $80 worth of dim sum in any other places, not even in NY. Maybe there are not a lot of dim sum places around in this location so they can price whatever they want.  I would not go there again.

XWnimEmehlmFaie6zdxkOg.text: Authentic Dim Sum in Charlotte.  Definitely not the best neighborhood, nor is the restaurant the cleanest place in the city, but where else can you find an authentic Dim Sum experience in the Queen city?  Recently went through a renovation (summer '14) and naturally jacked the prices up on their food.  You'll be looking at a lunch bill around $10 if you want to sample a few Dim Sum offerings and are drinking flat water.  Unfortunately, because of this, the value is rather marginal on their offering - it was a mistake in my book.  That said, however, the food itself is tasty and the experience of Dim Sum is unlike your traditional run-of-the-mill offerings around Charlotte, so it's worth a shot.  I'd definitely recommend the leak dumplings, the sticky pork buns, and plenty of that hot/oil/sauce they keep on the table - I eat that stuff straight.

S8GRptjMqEv_A7HJiu8q0Q.text: Food was great! Ended up having a lot of food to take home. The carts going around make you just want to grab and grab food. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because when we went to go pay, the lady at the register looked at us, with no smile or any type of happiness and said "type ISNT included"

photos.caption: Photo of Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. So good!

23-DwICMV4gh50kDOn2vTA.text: Came here to celebrate my sisters birthday and we ordered about 4 ppls serving of food so we tried a variety. It was good. The duck noodle soup was good and the domain was average. I have nothing bad to say about this place. When I wen the service was good too.

0VCaXJMZJEIPEN1RUekAaw.text: I didn't love it. I was really hoping to and wanting to but I'm not happy and satisfied with today's meal. We ordered the dim sum items for lunch. 10 dim sum items, an order of steamed rice, hot and sour soup, 4 drinks, and a lunch plate of sesame chicken plus 20% gratuity that was automatically added in for three adults, a 4 and 5 year old, and a baby in a high chair cost us $73. That's an absurd amount for just lunch considering we ordered just one of each dim sum to try. Some had two pieces, some had three, very few had four pieces. The flavors were good but when I'm paying $3.50 per dim sum dish, I'm expecting to be "wowed" and I was left feeling more like "ehh." Prices were too high for what we got and paid for.

photos.caption: Photo of Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the correct dim sum menu as of 8/14/15.

wQ4RFrmUPiVdGaxNOV8Eag.text: Leave it to Charlotte to have a dim sum restaurant NAMED Dim Sum Chinese Restaurant. Only natives understand the complex simplicity of this concept. This is one of two restaurants that serve dim sum in all of Charlotte. Thus, market strategy = all discreetness voided.   Despite the lack of creativity in the name and competition, the dim sum here is pretty good and actually better than the places I've tried in Atlanta. The dishes are flavorful and the food authentic. My favorites are the fried taro balls and stuffed eggplants.  Sundays are when they push the carts around. I recommend coming early (12pm or earlier) so you'll have dibs on "the good stuff." They always run out of my favorites early. Plus, that's when the food is hot and fresh!

dOWAO2pdNSYamhzmh34Qfw.text: MUST READ!!! The restuarant is under new ownership!!!! New menu in place. They still serve some dimsum but the other side of the menu is now completely fast food chinese dishes. I was highly disappointed as I don't just eat dimsum alone, I eat it with other favorite authentiic chinese dishes that are no longer available. Not that I don't recommend it but please be aware of this before you walk in.

jF9ghq3Q1WM3WjSKKbe_Dw.text: Please try this place, it's hella yummy. I ordered the chicken with garlic sauce add  $3 shrimp. Talking about a blessing!  Great spot for large parties.

CQIH4iY9iVVF8vtt3yJsUQ.text: I knew the food would at least be alright when I walked in: my group and I were the only non-Asian table there. That is always a good sign for ethnic restaurants. The beginning of the dim sum came out quickly, but as the restaurant got more full, it started taking a while (tip: don't be greedy, hire more people). The food certainly tasted good, but was nothing Earth-shattering. I cannot see how some of these reviewers on Yelp come here and order anything but Dim Sum. Why come here when all you want is Americanized Chinese? Jeeze...  I would come back. Why three stars? The food is just not that memorable. It was tasty, but nothing new.

NYaZ--1tRcEfQ-eZrthkfw.text: Dim Sum,. To borrow a phrase from Tracy Jordan, I want to get Dim Sum pregnant. It's a great place to go in the odd time in the middle of the day when you don't know if restaurants take a siesta, they are open straight through.   They also have house made soy sauce, be sure to ask for some.  I am fine with only ordering dim sum, but my friends wanted some Chinese food too, I was like.... well, how I always am.  Order away!  We had some house fried rice and Szechuan beef, both were pretty darn tasty. This restaurant is everything I love, it's the kind of restaurant you drive by and wonder what it's all about and then you try it and you can't think of any place else..

zn7fqoKGgcHtksE5mL4m9A.text: Being half Chinese and coming from Los Angeles I was looking for Dim Sum a restaurant in Charlotte. I found it and literally the restaurant's name  is exactly what it serves along with other authentic Chinese dishes. I brought my boyfriend here who never had dim sum before, he took a few bite and decided he loves this place. They recently did some renovations on the inside and it looks great. The ladies who work there are really nice and speaks English really well. Enjoy your dining experience, I know I did! :)

a2mVvwHP9fhqAEka9QDLCQ.text: The dim sum is great. Really good, pork buns are awesome and same with pan fried pork dumplings.

_WW_xAr_GpKKQSiqOCgEfQ.text: If I could give it no stars I would.  It is dirty and the food is gross. My girlfriend and I didn't eat anything. We just left.  I got the Singapore Mie fun. The shrimp were not cooked, and the noodles where gross. Service was just as bad. No one came to our table for 5-10 minutes..

b7aC8hLYFXsTpxODcmQFCw.text: Very very very very slow. We've been waiting for 40 mins for our dim sum when there even ain't so much people. Very disappointing.

y1CAgtd196EBfonOEMbWcQ.text: The food is AMAZING but the service SUCKS. They treat me like shit. Is it because I look young? It is crazy how they treat me.. I go there twice or three times a week, but lately, its only to go- cause i really cant stand they way they talk to me, ESPECIALLY the girl in the RECEPTION. And they would still be rude to me. I was gonna do my graduation party over there (graduated from CPCC)- it was gonna be 37 pple which is good business for them, but after the way they treated me today, HELL NO!!! Because I can tolerate everything, except pple disrespecting me.

msEdJbnoFFH0MLmBJDRB7Q.text: This place is so bad. Half of what is on the menu is not even on it. The people don't even speak any english, so ordering is very difficult. The portions are small for what you pay for. The flavor is way off from what they call "authentic" Chinese food. Basically there is No flavors. Oh please do not order the lobster. It's not the one that you've look at. My lobster came out way to fast to be chopped up and cooked. Looked kinda old. So basically this place is a no go on food service or anything else. Oh and have of my order never came out and they still try to charge for it

rwvRNn-ShGJzb7zYAb_Ylw.text: Since they don't have much competition in the Dim Sum category, I thought they could get away with crappy food but actually this place is pretty decent.  The menu items are standard across all dim sum places - I usually base my judgement of dim sum places on their chicken feet, spare ribs, haw gow, and siu mai. All these items were about right. One particular item of note is the fried taro/shrimp patty. The shrimp paste patty is battered with shredded taro and fried. Crispy, shrimpy and tasty.   One thing that I wouldn't order again is the roast pork - barely any flavor and not roasted enough.  The dearth of decent Chinese food in Charlotte has left my standards pretty low. It's pricer than what dim sum should normally be, but again, they can get away with that and it's solid food so I'm willing to pay it.

a4e4dCAG1aI2EXErkSS8Tg.text: We ordered from the menu and dim sum. The dim sum prices were fair but the dishes we ordered from the menu were overly priced and the portions were small. Service was slow but they knew they were going to add gratuity to our bill. Overall, the food was pretty good.

H1M56XvANfOIVGCt6bLtXA.text: I've been here several times for a private party (read: custom-ordered dinner) and the food was great. We're still in Charlotte, keep in mind, and I've yet to find anything that blows my mind enough I can brag to my friends back home In Seattle about. I'd settle for a place I wouldn't be hideously embarrassed to bring my dad the retired Master Chef to eat at when he comes to visit. But, at least there is acceptable, even sort of good, Chinese food in Charlotte. Service is good, but the restaurant tables are a little awkwardly situated that you might have to do some waving to get someone's attention.   I came back on New Year's Day for actual dim sum and I was satisfied. The food seems fresh and aside from a little bit greasy (it's restaurant food, after all) and a hint of MSG, it's totally fine by me. The chicken feet were good, the bbq pork buns were fresh and fluffy, pretty much everything was as it should be. The turnip (radish?) cakes were especially tasty and radishy. I wonder if they make it in-house. Other places have it so mushed up you can't barely tell from the texture it was a grated root vegetable.  I would, however, stay away from the rice steam cooked in the leaves. I've never seen anyone serve it this way. Instead of 2 or 3 small ones steamed in a little container, they have one absurdly large one (making it hard to share). They cut a flap of leaf open on the top and they jam a spoon into it for you to scoop it out. It can't work this way! The way the leaf-food works is that when it's piping hot, the rice slides off of the leaf easily when it's opened up. If you let the rice cool down, like, say, by opening a flap in the leaf, then it doesn't come off the leaf. You end up sitting there trying to scrape at the leaf, yielding you some bitter leaf bits stuck to your precious tasty sticky rice.   Bonus points to this place for having hot chrysanthemum tea. They also have jasmine, and pu-er, which are pretty standard to dim sum. I was pleased for a different kind of tea, which happens to be one of my favorites!  I think Dim Sum is worthy of carrying the name. At least for now. I still hope for more authentic and good Chinese in Charlotte. *fingers and chopsticks crossed*

BaUxCA0VYTcjl5SRBvyzzg.text: Cockroaches! BEWARE.   I do understand that it's pretty damn hard to have a restaurant free of cockroaches, one or two I can forgive. But this place is infested, and you'll find a lot of roaches in the dining area! I noticed at least 3 different cockroaches crawling up my chair. For that reason alone, I'm giving it a 1-star review.

nyZOOEpuRJlHvcxDTl6srA.text: I went to this restaurant for the first time today. As a person who grew up eating dim sum, this is place is NOT good. It is over priced, the service was bad, and the food was honestly awful. 100% salt, no real flavor. Not to mention the sanitation score. The restaurant cleverly disguises their sanitation score of 70 (the absolute lowest score a restaurant can have without legally having to shut its doors immediately) with a large leafy plant. It would be a better value to drive to a neighboring city to satiate those dumpling cravings. You'd be better off heating something up from the frozen section of Trader Joe's. Avoid at all costs.

8JqV3TFwtw7L1Az-nz8Lgg.text: I have been coming here for nearly 15 years the only reason I will give it 4 stars instead if 5 starts will be because of the cost. They have raised the prices of their specialty dishes and on the receipt it's written In Chinese so I don't know what I'm paying for, and knowing how they are, they are very quick to scam you u prices. With that said.  Dimsum here is FANTASTIC I love the food, I really do crave it but can never eat alone, everytime I go here I have to bring my family or atleast 3-4 friends to help out. Average ticket 250 bucks - 350 bucks but the amount of food that we get is insane! There are so many choices and so many good things I can't help but to order one or two of every dish that they offer! It's spectacular to eat family style meals like that bc your taste buds are gonna be so pleased with everything! Shu Mai, har dow, taro cake, clams with black bean sauce, sea bass fried with ginger soy sauce, Cantonese style lobster! All fantastic! This place I hold dear to me, if they was to closed down. I would be a broken foodie in pain

9Nh1l0VIqzy9YwoapzIEEg.text: On Sunday's for brunch they walk around with carts of food and you get to pick what you what.  It was really cool and something that I have never experienced before.  We went with our friends that have gone there before so they knew what to pick.  They told me that it was the most authentic Chinese food they've had in Charlotte.  Me personally didn't like most of the items we tried.  Some were just too sweet or just too odd tasting for me.  I liked some things but they weren't amazing to me.  I probably would go back though just because of how cool it was with their dim sum.  I definitely recommend experiencing a dim sum at some point!

-tew3sT_AjDt-bwacC9Jew.text: Food was not as amazing as I would have expected based on some of the other reviews. It was 3 star at best.   What ruined the experience for me was the service. When ordering hot tea for one person they give one teapot and charge for one tea. When ordering hot tea for 4 people, they give you one pot and charge for 4 teas. When confronted about this we were ignored.   When we tried to order more food we waited for the waiter for 15 min before we decided to raise our hands to get their attention. That didn't work and we tried to call for the waiter which didn't work also. I eventually had to get up and approach one of the waiters which I think is unacceptable for any restaurant with waiters.  When we got the bill they had already put on a 20% tip. I would have been ok with this if we had gotten service worthy of that much tip. I am unashamed to say that I left enough cash to cover 10%, which is generous relative to the service received that night.   Spend your money elsewhere. It's not worth this kind of treatment.

6PTJYiY5keFwXKaNHzgyAg.text: The food is okay. You have to know what to order to get the best of your buck.  Some dishes are a bit overpriced not that I mind it but the portions aren't worth that price. The service is 50/50 they are usually really busy on weekends and the service sucks but sometimes they aren't busy and the service still needs improving. I think it just depends on what kind of waitress/waiter you get. Their stuffed fried taros are pretty good and so is the shrimp crepes. Chicken feet and short pork ribs are also good. I come here often because it is one of the few places we have in CLT and because some reviews on some of the other restaurants make me a bit hesitant to try the others. Lol. Enjoy.

cgYHAg4-VoKqJDzGmxEDxQ.text: The food is good, I loved the spare rib, place needs a bigger selection on seafood however; I still recommend this place for dim sum.

Ue2ylzX7xdxvJL1qbajv6g.text: Best Dim Sum Restaurant within 3 state perimeter..New owner, good food & service. Glad they are back in business, I could not find any local DS as good as this restaurant's DS. I've had DS in many cities and this is as good..I recommend this restaurant..

V5lI5ToLlTUoSkB-dHYWWQ.text: Visiting Charlotte From LA and decided to hit Dim Sum up after family request.   We did take out VS dining in; not your typical nor best way to enjoy Dim Dum but it sounded good considering it being Christmas Day.   With all due respect-  It was the worst Dim Sum I've ever had.  To many items bought to list, ( $110) and everything lacked in flavor.  We was sent home without sauces; really guys?   Big disappointment -   Back to LA China town where Dim Sum is done right!

hYGAXxBfaGaShSezoahuCg.text: The menu and prices posted in other reviews are wrong! Selections of dim sum are not many, not as many as shown on the wrong menu in other review. Prices are higher than other dim sum restaurant at the same level.

luRz9IHfrDWlbOXCk4PkuQ.text: They have pretty good  variety of food loaded in total of 3 carts, and other dishes you could get it by odering. But I am not impressed by the quality. All the food tasted like MSG, some of them are either too dry or already cold. and they did not tasted like they were freshly made. I don't think the meal was worth the money at all, very disappointed.  Maybe I got too spoiled in San Francisco, but I think I'll rather give up dim sum if this is the only place you can get it in Charlotte!!

sKzE2A-bnHFoOW_TG5Ejqg.text: Such great dim sum and Chinese food! Everything we had was amazing ( esp the Peking dumplings! ). Highly highly recommend checking this place out!

Hm1k0Xyx_7Ixvbui60knQw.text: Alright so this doesn't actually deserve 4/5 stars but let's be real, there aren't many dim sum options around Charlotte and compared to the other places, I think this one is the best.   If you have had dim sum in NY or Cali, please don't compare it to dim sum here because it's not on the same level; however, it's not bad! They have your regular dim sum options that are reasonably priced. Their tea is pretty pricey though and we were charged about $6 for chrysanthemum tea.   All in all, come try this place out! Service is authentic- lol, but it's worth a shot.

13ZA9iVD0YTRhpOrZJd8eA.text: Went here with a large group after church. Having been spoiled by good Dim Sum in Atlanta and New York, I was looking for something comparable here in CLT. Needless to say, the food here matched up favorably. We ordered a bunch of traditional Dim Sum fare including chicken feet, garlic pork ribs (very delicious!), this deep fried eggplant dish, and some other deep fried morsels with ground pork filling. We even ordered fried pork intestines. For those of you who are adventurous, the intestines are worth a try. The outside is crispy with a soft and chewy interior. Beware though, there is an aftertaste...it is pig intestines after all.  Overall, good experience. The food was flavorful, and the selection was great. I will definitely be back for brunch.

d0aH7nhVeuRmEvN4LDIsIw.text: Very disappointed.  We were there at about 2 pm on a Sunday and there was no crowd to contend with.  We were seated in a corner of the side room.  The carts came by once, all at once, and we didn't see them again.  The dishes were barely warm and not at all tasty.  I used to bring my family here frequently about 6 or 7 years ago and it was a great experience.  Now I will not go back.

ZHdTFvLnPP_OmuWkx712sQ.text: "American Chinese", Authentic Chinese and Dim Sum!      If you have never had Dim Sum the menu has photos so you can see what it looks like!  If you take a friend or two (or 5) it is really great because you can have tastes of many small dishes and if you do not care for one you don't have an entire plate of one flavor!    They also have another menu that has what they call "Authentic Chinese Cuisine" for the MORE adventurous (more adventurous than Dim Sum) and "Chinese" (American as they say Chinese food for the uhhh less adventurous - Maybe I should not say that "Dim Sum" only sounds adventurous when you have not experienced it!  I have eaten selections from all three parts of the menu and here are the most recent dishes I have tasted!  Some Dim Sum is too plain for me.  Sesame Seed Balls are Delicious!  Wonton Soup! Very nice version!  Chicken Feet!  Boney yet Flavorful!  Glad I ate these though I was not making any Future Predictions!  Not planning any predictions, yet I was very VERY tempted to save the bones, though not for THAT!  Eggplant stuffed with Shrimp, better than 4 stars almost 5, with the House made Soy, ummmmh!  I have eaten these several times and all my Friends like these as one of the Favorites!  Shark Fin Dumpling...I'm NOT a fan, yet this one is very popular so do not go completely on my recommendation unless you see from other reviews that you like the flavors I do!  House Brewed Soy Sauce ! ! !  Ask for it ! ! !   Turnip Cake was OK.  Leak Dumpling, this one is pretty good 4 stars  Shrimp and Taro Root   Szechuan Beef 4 stars  Ribs... I do NOT recommend unless you have an idea about Chinese Ribs! 1 star!

zFq9sVFKXe7MrSAx8bJNxg.text: Worst Chinese food ever in the US. I even don't want to take the left over back. Overpriced and bad taste. Don't know how they can still open.

J_JukjE4dPN1xK_IdiGwRQ.text: This is a one of a kind experience for dim sum style dishes in Charlotte. When you enter and see so many Asian diners you know the food is authentic and delicious! I hadn't been there in a while so I was very pleasantly surprised by the redecorated dining room. Bright colors livened up the somber tones of an aging restaurant. There were the usual selections with some newer dishes I hadn't tried before. The steamed dumplings and bao are my personal favorites. Wait staff was cordial and knowledgeable. I hope not to wait as long as before to visit again.

h5AeqV79nJAyjGq8GW4C9g.text: The new Dim Sum is great. All the stuff I ordered at the prior restaurant is still there, same great taste and artful dumpling preparation. The carpet is new, chairs reupholstered, walls painted with new sconces. Gotta say I missed the waitstaff with the ongoing feud who were periodically rude to customers. The family who now seems to be in charge, they were so sweet and professional I hardly knew what to do with myself! We highly recommend the pan fried dumplings and pork roast buns. Thanks Dim Sum for opening back up!
